review_body: Best thing ever. Because I Recently moved to a new area with no friends or any idea were anything is, I cried many tears believing I had made a major mistake. Thank goodness for Meetup. It takes time to learn each groups rules and I have incurred a couple nasty people for breaking a rule I was not aware of. You can’t make a reservation and be late from work, or you are there but u don’t know them and they  don’t know you so you are armed as a no show even though you pay for your membership in advance. I always try to be courteous and am willing to pay for a meal when I can’t find the location. I also got kicked out of a group for cancelling a happy hour when a close family member died unexpectedly. But those are only growing pains. These people go to a lot of work and time to make these opportunities available for us. I don’t fault them, I just wish they would treat new members as a new customer to their business. I have met some of the nicest people.

I've only just made an account. Is this normal? Sign up was pretty bad on a purely UX perspective. Why is there no exit/done option for users when they're inputting their information? I tapped to enter my age and gender and had no way of finalizing an input, thus couldn't move on to the next field. If I scrolled down to my age, I couldn't hit "ok" or "done" or even a "x" to move to the next section of the sign up form. I opted to just tapping back and forth between things and the screen needed to jump around constantly for me to even be able to reach the "gender" input from underneath the scrolling pop-up for the age input.

Not Safe!!! I have an impersonator on this app! There is someone with my same name, in my same groups and same community with my same likes. Please note that my name is uncommon. You won’t anyone with my first and last name combined. I caught a screenshot of of this other profile with a photo. It is definitely not me, but right after I took the screenshot, the profile photo was removed. I reported this a number of times. At first, I thought I may have had established an account at an earlier time and had just forgotten about it. I checked my other emails but found nothing to confirm that. Now, I have proof that this is an imposter! I want this account deleted and I want a response to my complaint! Otherwise, I have to say that the people managing this app are doing nothing to keep the people who want to enjoy this app safe! I have a valid complaint and I have been ignored! The app is a great idea but I need to feel safe. Is this imposter staking me? Do I need to feel afraid to “meet up” with any of the social groups I’m interested in? I need this imposter removed and investigated! What is going on here? How can this be allowed and after I’ve made complaints? Developers (or whomever) pease, contact me further so that I may send the screenshot. I think I might have to report this to the authorities for my safety concerns... I’m only asking that the developers do their part.

Terrible App Several issues. The app crashes a lot, especially when I try to look at photos. I always see error messages—right now I am trying to see some events for groups I am a member of, but I am getting a message that the content is not available. Events are listed multiple times on the upcoming events section. The app doesn’t allow you to customize the push notifications you receive enough; for example I kept getting alerts every time there was a discussion in a group I’m a member of, which got annoying, so I had to turn off all push notifications from the group. When you look through events coming up, get out of the app, and come back, you have to start scrolling all the way from the beginning. I would like to be able to hide events from groups I don’t want to see. The app allows group organizers to put a so-called number of guests that are coming, which is often inflated by organizers to make it seem like more people are coming then there really are. A lot of the groups were created by club promoters in order to bring people to clubs and aren’t actually real groups. Meetup needs to crack down on groups that are using Meetup to promote clubs/people’s paid events. Like 30 grounds will all list the same event, and you have to scroll through all of that.

What a god-send for people in situations where they are lonely or want to meet new people! The app lets you search for groups or activities or events by key word....or just scroll through all the events that meet-up groups have planned for the week and just click to join and get the info!

Needed to find a place and some friends! Are used to Meetup as a recommendation from my sister who lives in Tulsa. She moved there and knew no one, so she got the Meetup app and found some things to do and people to meet, so she recommended it to me. I live in a different State and city and my circumstances are different. I stopped going out or doing anything and got depressed, so I use the app to get myself undepressed. I started out by just going to one yoga class and I just kept going and meeting new people and finding more more things to do and now I’m happy. I have also use the app to look up things for people in different cities and states that I care about and want them to find interesting things to do and people to hang out with. This app gives me the opportunity to check their area and make suggestions and tell them to use the Meetup app.

Pretty user friendly I’m new to Meetup and have only attended two events and have enjoyed both outings. The people are amazingly friendly, organized and very helpful. Especially to newcomers! I like the app and would give them a 5 star, except that it could use a couple more tweaks to further optimize it. For example, it doesn’t give us an option to provide feedback (such as volunteering to drive or asking for carpooling), during the RSVP stage. Only after having RSVP’d, we must go into the general comments. Another feature would be to allow folks to see the event description without having to RSVP first. Also, being new to the area, most people don’t know the acronyms which the event hosts use in describing or the names of areas. It would be helpful to have a little more descriptions (such as the level of difficulty, etc.) for the event. The State of Washington’s Mountaineering Organization has a very good system which could be used as a model. Overall, I’m very pleased and thankful for this organization. Thank you!

Great App... better people!! This app is easy to navigate. I like that you can go in and take yourself off an even you have RSVPd for if you have something come up. The reminders are also great to your email because we are all so busy already it’s hard to keep up with so many added events.

Great for travel 3 years after becoming a first time mom, MEETUP has jump started my social life again!!!  I relocated from NYC to south Florida when I was 8 months pregnant with my little one... needless to say, between being a new mom and moving to city with a MUCH slower pace, my social life pretty much took a deep dive then careened to the floor... when I was ready to start going out again, I had less than a handful of friends in my area who wanted to do the same things and were available at the same time. This led to constant cancellations and a few awkward solo outings. With meetup, I was able to connect with Like-minded women who were doing the kinds of things I liked to do so I could go out without the stress of having to do almost EVERYTHING alone. I also really like that I can send messages to the event hostess in advance if I have questions! Nowadays, I’ve been traveling to different states and I like to use MEETUP to find cool things happening in other places before I go!

Fun times, great friends, new horizons When I unexpectedly moved to the city to take care of my mother-in-law I did not know a soul. I started going hiking with a really good friend in Griffith Park through something called “Meetup”

Good but navigation is confusing and redundant I honestly don’t understand the quick-to-hate for this version of the app. However, they are right when they say this new version is not intuitive and doesn’t make sense. For example, let me go over the bottom 5 tabs are for navigation of critical aspects of meet ups: 1) find new meet ups (like an advanced search feature), 2) card view of current meetup groups and you’re able to browse new ones (honestly 1 and 2 should be combined. It’s redundant and is confusing), 3) the “check mark” icon tab is for your upcoming or past meet ups. This is where you go to see them. However the check mark symbol is a little unintuitive and confusing. It would make more sense to make it some sort of calendar icon., 4) group and meet up notifications, and 5) profile.

An App to Meet People I love MeetUp. It's safe and definitely more effective than dating apps that offer connections for friends. You get to see what events are close to you, join the group and then the event. I was in a new area, didn't know anybody and through this app I've met a lot of great people. We're buddies ever since and if it wasn't for Meetup, I wouldn't have had such wonderful experiences. I'm a homebody and this app is very eye opening and thankfully the people using the app are genuine outgoing people who have a zest for life and a heart for more friends. So yes definitely pleased. On that note, my only suggestion would be to fix the notifications! Since the last update, my icon badge doesn't show anything and when I tap I see I have notifications.
Great but $$$$$ to start a group I like this app. I’ve been able to meet people and while some didn’t work out as I hoped, I feel confident that I have a good group of people for what I want.

Still Learning My husband and I are fairly new to the area. We hoped to utilize this app to find more activities and people with similar likes and activity level. We like to golf, bowl, bike ride, walk, we’re dog owners, we aren’t musicians, artists, or historians, but we like enjoy concerts, theater, art, and history. My husband is prior military, which helped bring us together over 35 years ago. In the military communities we always had at least one person there who could recommend things and we did as well. We want to find a good community/group and enjoy participating in activities and getting to know others through this App. We’re interested in “meetup” groups who aren’t trying to network to sell something or hook-up. Just build real ‘old-fashion’ friendships and have fun. I do recommend this app. It is up to the individual and his/her time and trust level to be willing too venture out and meet and do new things.

Great for the Spiritual Community I have found incredible Meetups in different cities across the country for spiritual events that I may not have found otherwise. In particular, I love how many people who host Reiki circles utilize Meetup. I have enjoyed the many yoga instructors who post on Meetup and host their sessions outside of yoga studios in parks, beaches and chapels. I have enjoyed the hikes and philosophical Meetups and the vast array of groups that I can Meetup with and connect on shared passions no matter where I am.

What an awesome way to connect It’s hard to find other Blacks in tech and this app has given me the ability to do that as well as connect with all the other great engineers around the world that represent their respective ethnicities. All of my hobbies can be exercised on this app. Photography, software engineering/web development, Nature, sports, science, happy hour, socializing, you name it! You get a little bit of everything on meetup. And no one is here to tell you that something is or is not a good idea. Whatever you are passionate about can be pursued unabated and free or regulation and micromanagement. That’s the beauty of it all. Your imagination can take you and others that share it to the same corners of the Earth. So find out what you desire and what you’re into and are passionate about then go for it! Skies the limit people let’s all love and support each other to the best of our abilities. World peace, solidarity, equality, and freedom...meetup (no pressure by the way)!

So far so good. I am a new user of meetup. But I have been impressed so far.. This app is great for business owners to be on to inform people in your area about your services and or classes; extra. It’s also great for any and everyone of all ages to use. We all at some point look for something to do while we are out of the office or home; this app is a great tool to help you find something to do.

Portrait only view...very impractical...not for tablet audience. I HATE this app for one very significant reason. It’s portrait only. Desktops, laptops, even TVs are landscape. I have a new 2019 iPad Pro 12.9” screen, with split screen capabilities, which I use a bluetooth keyboard with. Turning my device on it’s side, which isn’t even supported by most cases or stands, just to view the few apps that are only available in portrait mode is a huge inconvenience and disruption to my workflow.
Love Meetup! I love the Meetup app! It’s pretty easy to use, it allows us to keep in touch with each other.  Activities’ information is clearly posted, we can comment and even download pictures!

Ok for members, coordinators, not yet. Easy for exploration and joining. Still needs some work for coordinators. Starting a group guidance could be clearer. I didn’t realize my preliminary group description and tags were to be published immediately upon approval. It would be nice to give a coordinator the option of deciding when to publish after approval. Could also make the iPad interface more easily maneuverable and manageable for coordinators. After a couple of weeks going in circles, finally deleted the app and went back to Safari. Better, but have some suggestions. Menu bars/options could be better organized. Members could be on one side bar with applicable menu items; and events could be on the other side. It would be nice to have option of msg board fixed to home page to see/reference along side discussions board. Unless new members know where this is hidden, the messages go unnoticed. Thanks for developing this app and continuing improvements.

Clunky + Alert bugs First, this update has caused an insanely annoying bug where notifications won’t clear. Again! I hate having that red dot and so I’ve had to turn off notifications until it’s resolved again. There already was an issue where if you get one notification that you subscribe to, the number changes to include all alerts total and that includes the “suggested groups” that you can’t get rid of.

Interesting! Recently found Meet up. While looking for ways to meet people and hopefully make friends. I have a tough time finding people with familiar interests. The more I dig into the app the more surprising the groups and certain interest I didn’t expect to see. There are so many possibilities. Interest in quantum physics, video game nerds, music, and just getting together to meet and have fun. I haven’t been able to go to any groups yet! But November seems to be a good start. I spend most of my time with headphones on and doing everything from car restoration to airbrush pieces and many types and styles of art, in general. I’m constantly looking for stimulation in learning. Right now I’m spending a lot of free time reading and questioning physics, especially Quantum physics! Anyways, I think this is a good place to start. I am hoping for a lot of interaction and conversations with Meetups. Thanks Joshua

I wish I would have known sooner I just discovered this app and I am writing a four-star due to the functionality of the user interface, amounts of people who actually participate on this website but I am short one star because I held a rally at the state capital not even two weeks ago and could have used so many of these people. I work with others who are trying to help people who are in pain, or pain medicine has been branded the new drug that will get you addicted. Literally, all you have to do is think about it or if you happen to see elicit the versions of it, law-enforcement swears it is the real thing and a prescription and you will be addicted. The sarcasm as my voice is real, you can’t hear it but it is there. I’m hoping that this website will benefit more in the future and it’s on a professional and personal level as well.

Hidden Fees and Bad Customer Service I only started to make a Meetup event on their website on my phone, and though I didn’t finalize it, Meetup still made me an organizer for a group which gave me an unexpected and unasked for $20/month subscription. I re-downloaded Meetup to make an event (unknowingly the app was $10), only after seeing that the event that I never even finalized, had gained members over 80 members in a few days. Didn’t know I’d be charged for anything out of this whole deal, and have lost $30 from thinking that this app could better my life. Though they collect money without explicitly saying it, they do not have a phone number to call when you find their unexpected charges in your bank statements. Much better to make meetups via a phone or email list instead of relying on these this fake and unethical service. I genuinely believe that they add members to peoples’ groups to rope them in and keep them subscribed and distracted long enough for their hidden charges to clear in you bank account.

Review and feature idea - request Hey y’all, I’ve never done an app review before but this has been on my mind every time I use this app for months now. Whenever I browse for events it feels like the list is bloated and searching becomes disincentivized by repetition. I’d like to see a feature which enabled blocking of groups to eliminate things you don’t like and free up the bloat within searching. Seeing the same things over and over whenever I pick it up has me not wanting to pick it up. It feels like fresh things are buried and I just am not appealed to read titles and scroll events I’ve seen every time I open this that id never care about. This app has given me good memories, albeit few, but all felt like lucky breaks and it’s felt very dry for very long for me for these reasons here. I’m here to put this review because I do care about seeing new life within this app and I’m curious about the receptiveness of its caretakers. Cheers friends and adventurers, strive to be great

Get connected with local events Meetup is great for local businesses and groups who use the app. It’s fairly easy to join a group, to get notified of upcoming events, and fortunately most, if not all, lead persons are understanding when you can’t attend an event. Response from lead persons has been quick, professional, and helpful/understanding.

Amazing app in many ways I love this app this is so much better than a dating site, after all life is about meeting people that have similar interest allowing us to build relationships and trust as we get to know people. I know the few groups I have been part of has provided such a comfortable envirment to talk with everyone and see what you have in common.

Never sit home alone - unless you are exhausted! There are so many opportunities from or participation in things you love to do as well as activities you would like to try.  Depending on the population where you live - you may be required to travel to a bigger town - or you could start your own Meetup group.  I belong to three different Meetups - one in Philadelphia, one in Columbus, and one in Boston - so I am never home alone even when I go for extended visits to see my family.  Each area has a different set of activities that are not only for single people - there are many groups for moms of young children, homeschoolers, fine dining with or without a partner, hiking, travel, movies, book writing - even groups to learn to speak or practice speaking a foreign language or to play an instrument!  Check it out yourself!

Meetup Over the Years My husband and I have moved a lot over the years. My first big move was devastating. I moved away from the family and friends I’d had for over 20 years. I couldn’t make friends because I didn’t work with anyone my age and the church we went to had older attendees as well. When we moved again I decided I was going to take action. I joined Meetup and joined a hiking group, an art group, and eventually a moms group. All have been fantastic groups. I’ve made lots of friends in my moms group because I’ve been a part of that one for 8 years now. It takes time to make friends, but sharing in an activity of mutual enjoyment makes the friendship even sweeter. Meetup has literally changed my life. What other website/app can I attribute that to? Not many. Thanks Meetup!
Great but Glitchy I fell in love with Meetup when we moved from FL to CA. Meetup wasn’t really a thing in FL but was big in CA. Met awesome people thru the different groups on Meetup.

Warning!! don’t pay for membership!! After purchasing i received an email from meetup stating that my subscription was not approved because Meetup does not support groups whose sole purpose is to sell or market goods, services, events, or event spaces. Really??? How many events have I seen on meetup that requires some form of payment. But what’s worst is that I’m offering free access to multiple events and I’m not approved.

Good Luck Trying to Deactivate Your Account There is no way to deactivate your account from the app itself or using the mobile version of the site. If you would like to deactivate your account, you have to use the desktop version. If you don’t have a desktop computer that means you have to look at the desktop version on mobile and try zooming in to figure out how to deactivate. Then, even if you are logged in on the desktop version of the site you will have to enter your password in order to deactivate, which if you had it saved somewhere or you were just logging in with Google seem to be impossible so you just have to change your password just to deactivate your account.
Godsend Moving to New Haven from Westport ct, living with my animal tribe, having experienced a trio of major life events simultaneously, I didn’t even want to leave the house!

Great way to find fun events and meet people I’ve been using MeetUp for almost 2 Years now and it’s been great! I found it after moving to a new state where I didn’t know anyone and the people I’ve met through make up almost all the friends I hang out with at this point.

Fabulous girlfriends More than I expected, the ladies here in SA TX are wonderful, if you are looking for true, genuine heartfelt women than this is the group!  We have so much fun and the events will keep you laughing for days. I’ve learned different games and have laughed for hours after, Oh let me not forget to mention the good food that comes with some of the events. I’m so happy I joined and let me just tell you the hostess are off the the chain with their kindness. They open up their homes and receive you like family. 😘😘😘😘🙏🏽🙏🏽🙏🏽🙏🏽. Pure kindness!
Great app for meeting people in a new place. I've moved twice in the past two years and Meetup helped me a lot by finding people have common interests and in the same city.

A Must Have For Growing Groups! Meetup has an intuitive, easy to learn interface that is a must-have for small, local groups. I was hesitant to pay for the service, but decided that trying it out for one month could not hurt anything. Only after signing up and having my group approved did I learn about the “Announcement” feature that Meetup provides. This feature alone makes Meetup the best service of its kind. Without the group announcement feature it would take me quite some time to find potential members. Instead, in less than a week I had a considerable membership base and have already set up our first group event which is currently at 80% capacity. I can’t praise Meetup enough and highly recommend it to other group organizers.

Connects you w Life, for Free! This app has no ads. (That Ive seen). It allows you to connect with similar people who have interests to yours, and find events or things to do based on your preferences. Its NOT for dating (unless you look for it). It sends you reminders for things to do, local, that you’d maybe enjoy. Some are free, some not. You can add that preference too. You can message people to ask details,  send payments, whatever. Im a single woman in my late 30s, no kids,  and I have a shortage of friends to do things with. This app is great, keeps me moving and feeling like the world isn't just zooming by when I get home, am tired from work, and have no ideas to do with life but veg. I really appreciate this app. Its got me out of my ‘me only’ zone on many a week night.

Disappointed, no connections I’m in a city (college town) of 121,000+ people, but I haven’t found a group that fits. It would be extremely difficult and probably fall to they wayside if I started a group because I have chronic health conditions. Once in awhile I’d like to meet with some folks and be a person. I’ve not made any acquaintances since I moved 7 months ago, but I don’t think it’s that unusual. People who already have connections stick to them.

Best tool to meet any type of people I have been using meetup since 2011. I used it when I move to a new state in the US and opened my real estate investing business. I have used this app to find investors, coaches, friends, etc.

First time using MeetUp I just tried MeetUp for the first time this morning... I joined the Sports Basement Run Group that runs Taylor mountain for 60min every Wednesday at 7:30am. It was just me and the event host this morning and she was completely welcoming, friendly and encouraging that I go at my own pace as I need... same as in a larger group. I made it 4.2 miles... it was TOUGH up hill for me, but I feel so accomplished for me first run in the mountains. To be honest, I was nervous to join... new situation and all, but having pushed myself to get out there, it turned out to be a great experience that I want to continue. I can see how it’s an awesome way to meet people with common interests and goals, make new friends and find inspiration and encouragement.

Meetup app is user-friendly. Would like profiles for users. The app is easy to use & very intuitive. I enjoy reading about Meetup events and connecting with other participants on the site. I wish there was a place to put a profile with some basic information-i.e. age, field of occupation, relationship status, & personal story (optional).  Certain Meetup groups list your answers to some questions about what activities or interests you have or like, but no real profile of the individual. Also there isn’t a group for beginner investors & some other interests that I have in my area, but that isn’t the fault of the app. Individuals just need to express an interest, & perhaps someone will organize such a Meetup. In general, I find it easy to find all upcoming Meetup events on the app & RSVP for them.

OC Meditation Group I have been exposed to many styles of meditation over the last 30 years and none compare to my experience the last two times I’ve attended this group. Daniel leads, what I describe as, a divinely guided meditation which allowed me to get back in touch with the REAL me and with purpose. That has been what I wanted all these years but was hit or miss with other meditations.

Perfect for my needs Considering that I'm new to big-city life and that I'm alone with no family or friends in my new home state, Meetup has been an outstanding service to me. I've met so many incredible people, so far, and I've only had an account for one week!
Meetup is Great; IPad App Needs Work A newbie to Meetup here, and I really like it the concept.

THE way to plug into your community Having moved around the country for the past 20 years with work, coming full circle back to my hometown, Meetup has been the very best way to find things to do and potential new friends to connect with.  Even being back where I grew up, 20 years away has changed so much that it’s still been hugely helpful to plug into a community I really didn’t know any more.  The app works well - search on things that interest you and scroll through the groups that match, tapping on each to read the synopsis of what they’re about and what kinds of activities to expect.  If you integrate your email it’s a pretty seamless experience to be informed about and respond to upcoming activities for groups you join.

Great way to meet new friends I just relocated to a new area with my boyfriend and sister, and this app really helped me and my little sister find fun things to do and people to do it with. I’ve been able to make a couple great new friends in the area with this app. There’s so many people on it in my area that it’s hard to imagine someone not being able to find something they like to do and people they get along with. I also know a lot of the people in the meetup groups looking to meet new friends are not new to the area, it’s really an easy way to organize events with people. We are having a lot of fun being able to do tons of things we never would have had the opportunity to otherwise.

Great way to meet people I have never created an event but I have signed up for meet and I like the way it keeps everyone in the loop by sending you an email with any updates. The only thing is that as an organizer you take a chance in people not showing up, after they said they would. Not good if you have prepared food. The dynamics are a bit different from perhaps a gathering with friends and family. You are inviting complete strangers from all walks of life who may not realize the importance of letting you know that they're not coming after all.  You can wind up with a lot of left over food. I've seen that happen. But I suppose you can always donate it.

Pleasantly surprised! This app is a legit way to meet new people who have similar interests. I expected it to be more like a dating app in disguise- but it’s not!!! I moved to a different state, was finishing up a two year long divorce and found myself at home alone a lot. This app was mentioned to me by someone who I shared that I was feeling sort of isolated- so I checked it out. I wish I’d done it sooner! Even during this horrible time- we had a happy hour zoom get together last night! And it was exactly what we all needed. It’s a wonderful way to connect with people and there is without question a group you will find here where you’ll fit in even if you worry you won’t. So great.

Easy to use, once you figure out how to set up Help section offers ZERO help with profile set up questions, including group selection ( request to join). Very frustrating to figure out on my own by trial and error.

Excited for the future!!! So happy to use the new options on the updated APP. Thrilled about the meeting rooms with WeWorks. I am so hoping that you can update the app to include where we can go back and retrieve declined members. This month I had begun a new medication and didn’t realize that my eyesight had been affected. I hit decline on 2 new requests. I later realized after medication had adjusted what I had done. We tried everything hoping there was a way to contact with them and nope :( not possible. Please see what can be done. Otherwise I understand all the ins and outs of growth, changes, and will faithfully continue to support MEETUP and BE PART of their network. What they do to help us all connect is awesome!!!
Missing features I’ve been an organizer on Meetup for about 1 year. The concept is great and I’ve helped people make friends.

Multiple pic uploads? When? Keep hearing that the photo upload is improved including the ability to upload multiple pics at once. I’ve not been able to upload more than 2-3 at one time. Otherwise it uploads just a couple then gives the infamous ‘error’ message. With 15-20 pics for any event, and EACH pic taking 20-30 seconds to upload, it’s not hard to figure out why we’re leveraging Facebook events for more of our communications. Come on, Meetup, get with it!

Great app with only one flaw — event reschedules If an event is created, and members signup and get a confirming their attendance email then for some reason the event sponsors must change the date or time of the event all the members are moved to the new date and time appears without a request to confirm they can still attend at the new date time, further no email notice of that change. Some sponsors cancel event and create new one ... that is unfair to those who have committed to the first event if there is limited attendance allowed. It is suggested that when a event is rescheduled a mandatory confirmation must be processed within ie 7 days to hold their reservation. Also there is no process if a user says post to my calendar to remove for cancellation or move for reschedules

MeetUp is great I recently relocated from a Houston suburb into the city.  One problem I realized is all of my friends are 30 miles away. I was suddenly faced with finding new friends at age 53.  The reflex reaction is go hang out at a bar and meet people.  The problem is you start with base commonality of drinking. It’s not that healthy and particularly at my age!  This app allowed me to find other people with common interests and immediately be in a group.  The events are fun for me because they are customized to my interests.  Conversation is easily started because we all know we have at least on point of common ground, and I can build friends from there.  It’s a brilliant idea!!!

Where in the World?? I really like Meetup. I’m inspired to use it the most when I travel to meet new people / find real local experiences. It’s great. I’m a New Yorker and I’m sure there there are lots of interesting local meetups, But I find that I’m far less likely to use the app now because my messages are cluttered with out of town / out of country places I’d need to fly hours away to attended. I don’t want to start new accounts for each new city. It seems an easy fix to allow a menu option or location sensitivity so that you can let the app know where you are or where you might be when you travel. This way the app will show you events that you can actually attend. Really important for traveling users which, I’m assuming so many of us are. Please fix. Thanks!

Great for building community This app is great for finding and building community. Overall the interface works pretty well, there are a couple of improvements I would like to see at some point : I would love to be able to email all attendees of a particular event (right now options only include the whole group) after a meetup and be able to provide a PowerPoint or other document as follow up to the meetup. I wish the number of characters was higher on the message board as well, it’s not totally great for collaborating right now.

Great app for meeting people and doing fun activities I started using this app to find pickup soccer games and it has worked great and I have found so many fun games to play with friendly and competitive people who love to have fun. I have since found a meetup for people speaking a language and that has been amazing too. There really is a group for everything and you will find people who are willing and in to meeting people and doing the activities that they find fun. Great app, most of it is free, occasionally some groups will ask you to pay a small fee (maybe $1-2) just to cover expenses but it’s well worth it. Truly a great app and everyone should try it.

Great app and free Meetup is a really great way to find groups of similar interest. If you live in a larger city, then Meetup will likely find an endless variety of groups to get involved in from outdoor rock climbing to volunteering and anything in between. I have also used this app when living in a small town and was surprised to find that there were still a lot of active groups nearby.

Great App! After breaking up with my partner after close to 4 years I found myself lost and lonely. I not only lost my relationship but the mutual friendships too which was very hard. I was going to pick up and move from this city because I thought I reached the end of an era but the universe showed me differently thanks to Meetup. I was able to join groups to get me out there and meet new people/ new energy that helped bring back the joy in my life. I joined several healing groups and it was fantastic. I totally recommend it if you are looking to meet new people with similar interests or are fresh out of a relationship and need to rediscover yourself!
Meet up is great but the app needs some work Here are some suggestions -

Best thing ever! This app is my social life. I’m retired and everyday I check to see who is doing something I’m interested in, curious about or committed to. I check the times and distance with my schedule and and then just check “I’m coming”.

Onerous and inefficient to find a meetup group Meet up seems to have cornered the market initially for an app that organizes and notifies people of group events. However this app is not user-friendly. It seems like the developers could greatly improve the user experience by creating a simple filter functions for Meetup notifications.

Needs Better Notifications I like Meetup a lot as a way to find new activities and organize groups, but it’s not a great way to communicate. The notifications are a jumble, especially if you’re a member of several groups. I feel like you should be able to sort notifications by group. I’d also like it if I was notified when someone posts in a Meetup group or when changes are made to an event, but it seems like the only way to find messages is to check your email or open the Meetup app. Does it not send push notifications? Actually, it would be REALLY great if you could turn on notifications only for certain groups.
Osprey Kayak Outdoors New to the “Meet Up” App, and so far, one for one, Meet Up for Kayak “DEMO” was excellent.

Connecting Great people!!! This app has been a game changer for me. I moved to Atlanta and didnt know many people outside of my ex-husband’s family. And they no longer wanted to hang out with me after the divorce so I was on my own.

Terrible App. No Cancelled Events Notifications I have used this app before the visual and interface update a couple years ago. I use it regularly to attend and occasionally setup events every week with my group.

Great app to meet people in a new city I had used meet-up in a small town before, and it was pretty useless since there’s so little going on anyways, but it’s been such a great tool to see what’s happening as I get adjusted to living in a new place and meeting like-minded people. I would suggest going to a few workshops or established events first that has a structure. I’ve gone to a couple of casual “hang” meet ups and the pressure to connect with one or two people that you don’t necessarily jive with can be a bit off putting, especially if you’re already pushing the boundaries of your comfort zone.

Crashes This app is great to find different meetups in your area with people that have common interests in varying categories. However, you’re unable to view their profile (at least I can’t) when you click on their image in the messages . It would make it easier to find out more about the individuals prior to meeting up.

Best way to meet new friends! The app and the concept is the best way to meet new friends! Plus, there are options for professional networking, dating, support groups, and more. So, this app is more like the best way to connect with new people for just about any purpose! If you’re interested in something and you don’t see a group for it, then create one and it’s more than likely others will join you. Sometimes, the quality of people whom you will meet might not be to your liking but you only need to make a few good connections anyway! I highly recommend this app!

Meetup Review As an organizer of two separate meet up groups, I find the new set up of meet up makes it easier to schedule events. One of the newest options with meet up is to actually tag the location of the meet up on a map and make it accurate. I also find that the new meet up set up is easier to isolate exact meet up events I am planning to attend in several individual meet up groups.

I’m a newbie & a fanzie Don’t have long term or in-depth experience with this app, but it’s proven review worthy to this point. Crashes unexpectedly but not hard open it immediately and pick up where I left off. The concept is awesome. I’m in a few social minorities where I live. I haven’t even known where or how to find friends. Then I stumbled on this app. I selected my areas of interest and it pulled up types of groups & events that fit.  There are groups for most types of interests, e.g. techies, programmers, gamers (both tech & board), outdoorsies, yogis, athletes, nature buffs, entrepreneurs, self-helpers, exercise buddies, travelers, artists, musicians, ... Freak yes. My life is about to be enriched by awesome peeps!

Lived here awhile & don’t  need friends so why?? I have lots of friends, I am married and live close by family and friends so you would think this app would be more unhelpful than my junk mail. BUT....I did a meetup for a friend who I was trying to help market his business and we met very cool people, once I was able to find my interests and modify the invitations that way I do see at least a handful of meetups I wish I could be at ever week. When my best friend gets dragged to a meetup she always walks out being so glad she came with me. I have met friends, associates and would recommend

Excellent service with notification issues Meetup is great, but being 2020 and all it has too many notifications and they’re too complicated to correct easily. If you don’t want notifications for reminders or comments, you have to select each individual group and turn those notifications off, one after another. At one point I turned off notifications for the app as a whole because I was too busy to dive deep into the app to fix it.

PC mentality is ruining Meetup I was recently let go from both the Boston Horror Society and the Boston Sci/ Fi group because the organizers of the groups do not share other people’s opinions and struggles. I joined these group three years ago because I because to wanted to meet people with a common interest.  I never PMed organizers with sexual harassment message or race discrimination, all I did was PM one of them about how I felt and it started a chain reaction where they conclude to ban me.  Its like they villianize me after building years of confidence with them and now I’m the worst person ever.  What a bunch of Snowflakes these organizers become considering the organizers of these groups tend to lean liberal left and are anti-Trump. I thought liberals are free thinkers and negotiators yet they’re just as cold hearted as the conservatives and Republicans they always rant and complain about.

Great app however it is limited I love Meetup. But the app has a limitation. When you turn off notifications for some groups, you continue receiving notifications. The only way I see to stop getting these Meetup is to remove yourself from the groups. That doesn’t seem to be the best solution. I travel to different cities and want to mingle with people. But when I’m not in those areas, I don’t want to know about their get togethers.

Lots of options - maybe too many In a new town, it’s hard to meet new people with common interests. However, San Diego is big enough that there’s something for everyone. Unfortunately there’s a lot of some things and not enough of others.
Overall I like meetup, however… Meetup and the app work good, I’m not a fan of the amount of money that meetup charges long term to be on their site.

Wrong instructions in App Support App Support instructions are wrong in many ways. Someone in support should try all the instructions on each supported platform and open work a work ticket for each error. One defect example is changing profile photo on IPhone where the instructions claim there is a workaround for the defect where changing the profile photo does not show the new photo on existing group memberships. It states each group can be changed individually but there is no way to do that. It states the profile photo is used on all groups that do not have an overriding photo but that is false because it just leaves all groups with the photo that existed before the profile photo was changed and there is not way on an iPhone to override a photo for a single group.

Works Great! I’ve been using this app for over 5 years. It serves its purpose to help people find whatever interest groups they may be into. I’ve used it for networking/career related meetups, vegan meetups, fitness meetups, and even happy hour meetups. It’s a good way to meet new people with shared interests or just a way of keeping your calendar full if you’re new to a city. Use it when traveling too if you are looking for random events to check out. It’s pretty fun and most of the events listed are free and if they’re not it’s not anything that’s going to break the bank.

Terrible and limited This app from and organize zeros perspective lacks everything. Not only that it crashes and pulls up a message that reads completely off the frozen page wit no option from the top to delete or disable it leaving the app frozen even after restarting it or after rebooting the phone that really lame! You have to delete the app from your phone and re-enter your membership information. After 5 times freezing this app is not good or worth my time! You can’t create, organize, adjust or modify an event or send emails out all you can do is lookup events or opt in or out of an event and message someone within the app so they have open the app and go to message to get the message (worthless), so it’s not a true messaging capability? This is almost worthless!

Awesome way to connect with the community I started my first meetup about a month ago and it’s been so much fun! My members have given me so much positive feedback and thank me all the time for creating a space for them to connect, share, and socialize. Meetup made it possible.

Wonderful to socialize with other lovely people around you! I’m a fitness freak , but I’m also little introvert initially , so this is a great place for me to explore fitness oriented groups, and to come out of bubble and start socializing with lovely people around you!

Meetup plus WeWork is the next evolution in professional social networking. Recently I’ve been using the Meetup app to schedule times for my groups to meet at one of the local WeWork offices. It is saving me so much time I thought I could at least slow down a moment and write this review. I used to have to secure a meet up location and sometimes make deposits before having commitments from the group. Also I love to schedule Group activities same day which I have been doing more and more of since the new integration. Thank you guys, we noticed.

Mahjong in Denville I was so happy to find a wonderful group of people to play Mahjong with in NJ. Everyone is so welcoming and flexible. There’s no commitment. You just join the Meet Up app and sign up for the days and times you want to play. The communication is responsive, and it’s an easy-going group who will play with beginners (who know how to play but may play slowly until they get more experience) and intermediate level players. There are more groups being developed at different locations, so, if you love the game, and want to make some new friends, please join us!

Awesome way to meet friends Perfect app to meet friends if you just moved to a new place or to find friends with same interests. I have used this app in different states in the USA and I have made great significant relationships through here. I even became a meetup organizer because I know it works to create relationships .. a lot of my members have said that thanks to my events they have made friends. I recommend this for anyone even if you are not a social person because this meetups members are all different and you will definitely hit it off with someone for sure.

Great with a few glitches This app works well for the most part. The two problems I can think of are 1) sometimes someone comments and when you hit show me from the alerts, it then is blank where the comment should be. You then have to back out and go the event itself to actually see the comment. 2) the alerts don’t always show up. I just randomly went in to check it and there were 10 events that were created since i last checked but weren’t showing as  notifications. Overall these things aren’t a big deal and I use the app often.

Hmmmmm I just drove 45 min; paying $8 for parking; told it was a “free” seminar in Meet-up app for the whole weekend & that there was a buffet meal... show up at 6:pm. I did pre-register on the “meet-up” app indicating that I was coming and I got a reminder as well to let them know if I was cancelling.

Superb One of the best events I ever went to was with L.A Homsey. That even felt so fulfilling and authentic. I literally couldn’t ask for anything other than that. She really put a great event together. Everyone had the energy I was looking for, it wasn’t just about business but really just connecting on a level that eliminated the outside world. Life changing. I did not feel outside of the box or even like I was in it. I felt like it was just a place and time of belonging and filled with purpose to do something different but yet the same in a weird sense. All shout out to L.A Homsey!

New in town I recently moved to a new city by myself and one of my biggest problems has been finding a new local friend group. It’s difficult meeting new people as an adult if you don’t know where all the cool hang out spots are at but this app is helping me out A LOT. I would recommend you find your first group with a strong host that can communicate where exactly you can find them because nothing is more awkward than walking into an unfamiliar place not knowing who to look for. I can’t wait to see what kind of people I can meet here 😁

On-the-Go Action I am an active and organized person, and this app keeps up with me (better than people). When I am in the mood to be curious or wander, the Meet-up app allows me to choose from an array of activities on any given day.  What’s cool about using this app is its usefulness.  For instance when I am traveling I use it to see what’s happening in an area I am unfamiliar with, and venture out if I have time.  The events in this app are uber easy to locate by date, group, and location.  It’s my go-to activity app to search for events, save what interests me, and track what I have signed up for so I don’t miss a beat.

Don’t stay home! I have been using this app for 10+ years. I made friends wherever I moved to. It made my move from one city to another a breeze. I can always count on meetup to plug in to the action and discover the city fast. This is my go to app everyday. Thank you guys!
A nice alternative to social media Social media are convenient for communicating with like minded people no matter where they are, but they cannot substitute for real-world human interaction.

Great app Great app. Had it not been for meetups, I probably wouldn’t have found the veteran take the rock challenge. I might have ended up spending a whole lot of money doing it with a group of other people that I might not have solid connections with being a veteran myself.

A helpful tool for relocating I recently moved to a new city and have been able to connect with folks with shared interests. I gave up drinking and didn't know how I'd make new friends without going to bars like I always have in the past. A friend recommended this app and it has helped me expand my new social circle. If they don't have a group for you, you can upgrade your account and be the organizer of your own new community. Totally recommend this if you are someone new to a city or looking to meet new folks in your current city.

Please let us go back to the last version I, like others who rarely leave a review/ rating, feel compelled to agree with other 1 star reviewers that this new version got it so wrong. Sorry but this new version is anything but intuitive and I find myself OFTEN giving up after about 5 minutes of trying to find things as simple as the photos from the most recent meet up.  Please listen to us single star rate people and make the information more obvious and easier to navigate please!!!

This is ingenious! I am a new resident of the State and didn’t know a single person here in Jacksonville. While searching for housing, a librarian back home in Ohio, told me about this app and I’m so glad I remembered once I arrived... then gave it a try!

Love Meet-up Meet up has provided me with many opportunities to make new friends, learn new hobbies and become more social. It has essentially changed my life for the better. After retiring I needed to get involved with people who shared similar interests that I have.  It was hard to find this on my own as none of my current friends wanted to paddle board or learn pickleball or go do the other active things I wanted to do.  Then I discovered the Meet Up App and it opened up a world of possibilities for me. It made my transition into retirement seamless.  Thank You Meetup!❤️

Meet ups This is such a wonderful idea. People are so isolated from each other in this technological age. I did find that some gatherings were not clear about the location they were held in. ( no specific address given)I also noticed that several meet ups said nobody was going, which would make me not want to venture out, especially as many locations are about an hour from me. I hope to make some get togethers in the near future but I am not home now. I see they have them here in Sarasota, as well.

Love it! Wish people more my age would love it too! I love this app! I just moved halfway across the country and while everyone at my work (reason I moved) are fun and great people, I really want a life outside of work too. This has also been a great way to learn new things and find new hobbies. I only wish there were more younger people on the apps. A lot of the meetups are people around 30 which is not bad but I’d like to meet people closer to my age (21). There are groups that cater to people in their 20s but they tend to be much smaller and further away.

Great Way to Meet New People There are tons of things to do & people to meet on MeetUp. From Weekly Movie nights to Board Game clubs & even groups for people who just enjoy a little conversation. You pay nothing; not to download it, not to make or sustain an account not even any “in-app purchases”. Also there’s no minimum of events that you have to go to, just attend events based on your schedule. So with all that said whether you’re a loner or a socialite you have no excuse for you not to try it...so stop reading this & go download it already

Kontenders I Joined this poker league a few months after moving here from Oregon to meet new people. I have thoroughly enjoyed myself and I’ve met some great FUNNY people.  There is absolutely NO cost to play and you get all kinds of extra chips for showing up early, bringing a friend, registering online, etc...I can’t say enough about this group. They play every Saturday at 3:00 and Tuesday night at 7:00.  Both locations are perfect for me (and nice). If you love to eat, laugh, make new friends, and win cash playing poker you’ll love this group.

One of my favorite apps UPDATE: Please fix the notifications! I have it set to NOT notify me of reminders, but keep getting them. It's very frustrating to have my phone blow up over crap I don't want and have set it to not show me. Thanks!

This app is life changing Meetup honestly has changed my life. I went from being a person who had moved around a lot and really struggled with making friends, to being someone who has friends, has hobbies, and can comfortably navigate social situations, all because Meetup has given me the outlet I needed to practice making friends and trying new things. Even if you have to plenty of friends, even if you have plenty of hobbies— give this app a try. It’s perfect for all those who are explorers and adventurers at heart.

Love this App, but... I really enjoy using this App to stay up to date w/my groups & others, but one thing I WISH would get FIXED is that when I update/remove members on the Website, the App never shows the changes.  🙁  The Removed Members are still there for a long period of time.  As an Organizer of several groups, this is not productive & it’s annoying!  I keep up to date on Updates which doesn’t change this issue.  😑🙁.  Another Problem, I’ve noticed that the Description can sometimes be Eliminated from my Activity on the App.  😵😳. PLEASE FIX THESE FLAWS!  Thx very much!  🙂

MeetUp New to using the MeetUp App. I’m still poking about using it. For the moment, it is functioning well as a participant in a group. A negative, the moderator can’t set-up weekly folders that photography group participants can upload to. On iPhone, unable to select where in photo folder, that I want to view photos. Currently, one must step through the 100+ photos to get to the newer photos they want to view.

A bit disappointing I just started with the app and so far it’s nothing great. The first meetup was a music festival and 10 people were signed up to go. The organizer did not go because it was drizzling outside and the rest went to the bar. I did not sign up to hang out at a bar. I stayed and enjoyed the concert by myself. I stood under a tree and never got a drop of rain on me.

Terrible customer service I canceled my subscription in October and was reviewing my bank account a few days account and saw I was charged in December for the membership.  I assumed it was an error and reached out to their customer service email, and all I got was that I didn’t cancel it, a link having me cancel it (again) and said that because it was still “active” that I didn’t qualify for a refund for the 1 month.  I replied and stated again that I already canceled and 3 different representatives told me the same thing.

Met Positive Life Changing People I cannot tell you how desperate I was to meet people who enjoy the same things I do. I moved to an entirely different county, 2 hours away from my friends and family and after 2 1/2 years, was yet to find friends outside of work. I turned to MeetUp, searches through groups I felt I could relate to and not even 3 days later I was meeting a group of 14 like minded girls, tossing back drinks and exploring downtown. I went 2 1/2 years with no social life and I cannot thank MeetUp enough for creating this amazing app!

Meetup is a must have app! If you travel for work or often find yourself somewhere where you don’t know a lot of people the Meetup app is great for helping you find things to do.  When I moved cities many years ago I was able to build a new circle of friends who shared my interests.  I believe my quality of life is the best it’s ever been as a result of having Meetup to bring together people like me to quickly find shared interests.  Everyone needs to know about and use Meetup at times in their lives.

Rose I'm impressed with the Fabulous Girl Friends’ Meetup!  After my second retirement, I needed something to do. My friend who had recently retired invited me to the hiking event.  I enjoyed the hiking and the ladies so I didn't hesitate to join the Meet-up on the spot.  The coordinator Frankie is awesome and one of her co-coordinator Barbette is adorable.  They are always looking for different and interesting events to add to schedule.  There are variety of activities to attend just about every day of the week that include days, evens and nights.  A place to meet new friends and have plain old fun!

Great way to meet new people, network, do what you like & try new things! This is a great app (at least in Hawaii) to meet new people and try new things. It’s also a great way to kick yourself back into a good habit; remembering a lost second, third, or fourth language or exercising again. I would think the experience is the same all over the world where this app works and where groups meet but I haven’t had the opportunity to attest that statement however I’d be willing to test that statement given the opportunity.

Mountain Mama’s gathering at Arden Music Festival My first meetup ever!  I’m glad I came. Turned out to be nice to meet some new friends . I felt welcomed by all the group members who attended. I often attend events alone and was happy to sit and dance with other Mountain Mama’s for this one. I was greeted almost immediately, as I had posted info about my appearance to the group page before I arrived. I’ll probably attend other MM events if they fit my travel schedule The moon was a deep coral color as it rose in a clear sky! Thanks to no more rain for a couple days.

Meetup I like hiking but not always by myself,  when I was told about Meetup I was curious about it. I really wanted to discover the different trails of Ohio and meet people who enjoy the outdoors. I’m on my 4th adventure now, I love Meetup because everyone can join, it’s free! But personally I think it is way cooler than most other apps, Meetup is where real people go, for me it reminds me of the days when people enjoyed the simple pleasures, the Meetup app gives opportunities for being, for doing, for the love of living, and what a joy it has been!

Meetup App This is a great way to meet people, or become a part of a group in a social setting.  The group consist of people from all walks of life but together we all have a common goal to get out with great people, make connections, and enjoy activities that may not have been thought of or possible.  Because you’ve joined an outstanding group of people anything is possible, and I almost forgot we always seems to end up eating at wonderful hidden gems.  If you join you won’t regret it.

It's getting better but still plenty of rough spots Meetup is a great service but the app has been a barrier to using it. Looks like it's getting better though - especially in the search area. Hope they keep focusing on improving this part.

Choose wisely Great idea for a social media app! But in the beginning when you add interests, be careful what you choose to come up in your feed because it doesn’t seem like you can delete them once chosen. For instance I added Chinese culture as an interest, but the kinds of things it brings up is gatherings for only-Chinese people....and I’m not. So just pick a few topics you like at first, then can always add more later after you get to see how it works.

Nice for people looking for new friends I was looking for an app that doesn’t revolve on dating only & this app is perfect for me, because I was able to meet new friends. Great experience, but on technical side there’s probably a glitch. Because I have notification all the time but I can never view them unless I go back to the group(only if I remember which notification is it for). I wish there’s like an attendance button as well, like you have button for who actually showed up. Because some people will say they are going, but they really aren’t.
Nice User Experience Generally speaking, Meetup did a great job in user experience design!
Great Service, App Needs Improvement Update July 2019:

Not navigable, discoverable. Slow. Buggy. After oauth signing with Facebook, kept asking for password. Can't reply to comments on a meetup from the notification screen. Takes five minutes to find the messages (or any feature, really). Overall poor ux wrapped up in a decent ui. Also, extremely slow. And I want to be able to use all the characters I want while describing my meetup! Can you please rerender the escaped greater/less than characters please?  Basically this app is barely useable.

Meetup is a great way to get to know a new city I moved to LA from Miami 3 yrs ago knowing only my daughter and her family. Meet ups has been a great way to find my way around a new place from theGriffin Observatory to bowling with a bunch of slight drunk folk in Culver City it’s been fun. I’ve done the Venice Art Walk and Jazz on Main Street I’ve even taken my dog to some Yappy Hours. And it’s all been fun and stuff I would not have done if it hadn’t popped up on my phone and lured me out into the world. Thanks Meetup for giving me a real introduction to my new hometown!

Growing up with BNI Although I had been in business for almost 10 years before I joined BNI, my business not only grew, but grew up since joining BNI. I have 30+ role models to look up to every week, who guide me through even the most turbulent times. Growth is not easy. Growing while still maintaining the same level of quality service is even harder. BNI has given me the tools and the support that I need to stay competitive, yet continue giving my customers the excellent customer service they deserve

Liking the new changes I was on the verge of leaving Meetup because I felt they weren’t invested in helping my meetup succeed. Just as I was deactivating my page, I noticed the upgrades they’ve made by partnering with WeWork to host events and reaching out to the organizers to get together to share ideas. I missed the meeting because I was cancelling my page but now that I’ve decided to give it another try, I’m anxious to see what more they have in store. I look forward to building my group... CurvyGirl Fashion Network in Chicago. lol 😉

I’m happy with the functions in this app. This is a review which was prompted by the app itself. I’m like my meetup groups and love the concept of meetup. I have enjoyed that, but I don’t really care about the app per se. I would be happy with using the web browser for the same purpose. Is the app an improvement? I can’t tell. But in many ways that is a good thing. This app isn’t totally lame. It’s like asking me to rate ice. It cold. It it were dirty or melting I would comment on those definite problems. But otherwise, it’s good that it’s cool.

Luv the idea - upset over service I absolutely love the idea of this app. I’ve gone to three events in the past week and have many more on my calendar. However, when I first went on I started my own. Confusion on my part I thought I was signing up for a $10 charge for each month for six months and they charge me $60 and I really do not have the money right now. I did everything I could to try and get reimbursed I cannot find a contact number whatsoever. I can’t afford food on my table right now I should not beWasting money on a fun project.

Wish I could search on groups instead of events… I can’t find any place in the app where you can actually search for *groups* by interest – I can only find a place you search on *events* that are happening. On the *website*, I believe you can search on groups by subject… Frustrating…

Great App The app is impressive. It’s user friendly, easy, and responsive. It is easy to customize preferences and even saves settings on its own as you adjust things to your liking. Small things like this show the app was developed intentionally with user experience in mind. I appreciate the service meet-up provides and the app makes it easy to take advantage of the opportunity to learn new skills, enjoy experiences, and meet people. It’s excellent. I wish more apps were as well developed as this one.

Clear and easy to use. This app is better to use than the native site. Besides ease of use, it’s a fantastic application to get involved in social activities and finding others with same/similar interests.

Conceptually great! Could use some polish. Conceptually The app and it’s purpose is really cool. I love how it links together people of similar interest and shows a plethora of new interest for those who are looking to expand their interest and social groups. There are a few functionality and interface problems. Such as it can ONLY be used while on WiFi. The chat message and notification section can get a bit convoluted. It is easy to lose chat threads or have them go missing altogether. The way it archived and keeps chat threads is unreliable. The interface usage could use some further polishing.

Trouble with signup/login I attempted to make an account today, after several tries it appears I have an account setup. The only problem is that I can only access it from a web browser and not from the app which makes it very unappealing at the moment. Every time I try logging in through the app it says my password/email is incorrect. I’ve double checked my email(it was correct of course) and I’ve reset the password to one I would never forget, still no access to the mobile app, I’ve become frustrated with continual tries and no results. Also I was unable to find a ‘contact support team’ link on the web browser which may have been user error or too hard to find.

DO NOT use this app. You will never be able to use Meetup again if you do! This app is terrible - I wholeheartedly recommend just using their site. The only way to join groups is to search for them online.
Excellent and easy way to create a group of new friends! It worked for me! I hadn’t heard of MeetUp, but I found it while searching for local groups that shared my interest.

Great for activities of all kinds Whether you are traveling , new to town , or are a native to your area this app is great for all kinds of meet ups and activities and most of the groups are ran well by the group leader , you know you have a good group leader when they update their location and what they are wearing the day of the meet as well providing information / tips about the area such as cover, parking and location vibe. A must for anyone looking to explore their city with a group

Meetup app Thumbs up; both of them👍👍 pardon the two left hands lol I couldn’t find the right hand angle. Honestly it’s been a really helpful app n was my first foray into social media or any semblance thereof- I even had avoided my space n it was great too once I created another social media page n am running political page now and yet I still rely on and use daily my meetup app - muy bueno! And it is free. Can’t go wrong..... unless that’s your thing lol n then u can find others into your cup of t- sew too speak/write....😎

More of a breakthrough Meet Up allows others having similar goals and ideas to actually MEET and exchange thoughts, plans, and/or ideas. Even social movements are covered! Whether it be hobbies or innovative ideas this app allows people to collectively meet and move forward.. Its great! I use it all the time (being that I’m in Real Estate)..  There’s something in it for everyone! Social, Political, Industrial, etc... There’s literally no discrimination vs. any mindset, skill level, or field of practice! Good luck with your “innovation!”

Meetup app streamlined user experience It’s a good app. If you are on here and don’t have the app, you’ll get 50,000 emails about events and have to scroll to find what you are looking for or worse- log in. Just breakdown and download one more app. Meetup is absolutely fantastic and tracking your events, & event logistics is just going to exponentially easier on the app. I put it off, b/c one one of those “I don’t need another app” people. But, let’s face it — I did. Meetup is cool and it’s even better on the app.

New to a city & Being a new graduate person I haven’t had much luck due to my shyness and hesitance towards finding my way to the actual meet up spots. But if I could rate anything, apps, friends inviting me to parties, walking around trying to make friends all the time, meet up is so so so helpful. Just know what you’re looking for and have a mind open PLUS feel like you can socialize personally. You will get exactly what you’re looking for, only if you try to make an effort. :)

Great way to connect At the suggestion of my daughter who found a wonderful group of friends after she moved to a new location I tried it. Newly divorced after 40 years I did not know where to begin. I found a wonderful divorce support group that met regularly and several other groups for activities. The more I expanded my geographic area more was available. Thank you Meetup for helping me start a new phase of my life with many interests and activities to choose from.

Meetup Meetup is a great opportunity to meet new people! I have used it when moving to new cities and it’s been a lot of fun! You simply choose a group to join based off your interests and choose which events you would like to attend. You even have the option to host an event if you’d like. Some groups are public some are private but you just have to send a request if that is the case. It’s been a great way for me to explore this new city I’m living in and socialize!

It’s a fantastic way to meet likeminded people I’m a member of three Meetup groups and in all three groups I’ve met amazing and interesting people. I’ve made friends with a few of the women and it’s been a lovely experience. There’s an easy camaraderie that develops quickly and a sense of fun and security even if it’s your first time. The variety of interests groups is staggering! Whatever you want to try, there’s probably a Meetup group that’s established. Or, you can start your own group! It’s easy!

Safe way to meet interesting and nice people doing things that they/you enjoy I was looking for ways to have meaningful activities on Long Island and Boca Raton.  I have found walking and nature groups. Each time I participate I enjoy the activity, walk hike and meet other nice people who are interesting and caring.  I love Genuine Friends. I participate in learning activities, museums, book clubs as well as happy hours.  Ellen is incredible.  Identify your interest and Meet-up your experience will be valuable

One of the best products ever created is meetup! I have to say this is the best way to get niche groups of people together. I’ve attended a lot of tech meetups and love this app telling me when and where they are. I think there’s one issue for me being in Central NJ there’s a lot of NYC meetups that I would love to be able to filter out of my search results. If the meetup group had the exact location more prominent that would be helpful as well. Great product, thanks for making it so great!

After work clubs for adults! Meetup pretty much reminds me of after school clubs but for adults. It’s a great way to meet people, network, make friends and learn new things happening near you. I joined a few groups when I moved to a new city and I’ve found so many things to do! I even became an organizer after some time and love it!

MeetUp Scales Up Opportunities, Growth, & Awarness As a new business venture capitalist and creative entrepreneur I depend on creating sparks of notice to new audiences in order to initiate new platforms for community building experiences to launch from before investing fully in the project. Meet Up allows anyone with an idea driving for results in other to create local and global impact a safe space to discover new directions, test the waters, and play with a dream or idea with less stress, honest feedback, and success in a public setting.
UI seems to have problems so far tried leaving a comment in a group—which was going to be my second of the day—and got the pop up that i’m “capped at 20” and was prevented from commenting 🙃

The best way to make real friends If you want the best, most social, connecting way to meet real people with common interests this is it. Everyone on here is here to meet new friends. So the ice is broken. Without this app, there are or would have been a lot of great people I would have never met in hard times of my life, which is when you need friends most. It gets you to try new things, meet new people and have new experiences. Meet up has changed my life.

Great app with an efficient layout design. Meetup is a very great idea for those who want to narrow down their search pertaining to what appeals to them for both activities and just social environments in general. It takes time, effort, and some patience but with that in mind you can eventually find a group/collective of inidivudals going out to the movies, cafes to chat etc. to meet with. This app from Meetup makes this a more efficient reality to pursue from the palm of your hand. Well done Meetup!

Asked for Password So I decided to create a MeetUp group and I clicked create a group and it kept asking for my AppleID password which I thought was off. Kept clicking cancel and create group again. Decided ok whatever enter password it’s not asking me to buy anything. Then it takes me to a page that would let me subscribe without entering my password again (depending on your settings of immediately require password, 15 minutes, etc) and gives me the option to pay $16-$23/month to create a group on this app. Ok bye Facebook creates free groups and over a billion people are on Facebook and they don’t try to trick you into subscribing. Jesus that’s like double the price of Netflix per month.

Meet up works for me I am single and moved to Chattanooga 3 yrs ago.  I have found my activities on Meet up such as Euchre have the nicest people I’ve ever met.   Most of us are all from the North and Midwest. We all love playing and teaching the card game to anyone that wants to learn the game of Euchre.  Come to Meet Up and look for something that interests you.  You will Meet The nicest people that may share your talents and you will find something to do any day of the week all Month long.

This Latest Release is Great The mobile app does a great job of staying in sync with the browser version. There are more options with the latter, but this app gives me access to what I need to see and change (as an Organizer) frequently. Messages, for example, are instant and allow me to switch back and forth from either platform in real-time. RSVPs are live as well. To me, this makes for a great mobile app because it’s not just statically displaying info. Rather it’s dynamically letting me interact with the info in real-time.

Meet up The meet up app is great. At one point I was a member of 98! I got a little carried away. The sponsors of the groups are always well organized and friendly. I am impressed with the variety of activities and hobbies.

Meetup rocks I founded Bayou Writers Club in Mandeville, Louisiana and Lone Star Writers Club in Dallas, Texas; and I can tell you from creating both those groups that I have met some amazing people that I consider some of my greatest friends. I learned more about this industry. I met incredible professionals within the industry, and I know you will too. Find whatever creature bliss and follow that through meet up because it is an incredible experience! Have courage to follow your dreams and connect with likeminded individuals!!

better than google On a recent road trip google searches brought me to meet up where I found a community of healers twice that I thoroughly enjoyed in the Phoenix area. Now back home on my off days I’m able to find events and people around me so quickly that I other wise may not have found from google searching and word of mouth. This app is extremely efficient and to the point and easy to use and navigate!

Opened my life to new friends after my husband died. As many women know after divorce or death of their husband their life drastically changes and so does their social life. You don’t fit anymore in many social activities.
