My Meetup group has allowed me to meet and make many new women friends with whom I am able to go shopping, see a movie, walk and talk on the beach, and enjoy activities as a group,  I am no longer lonely and look forward to everyday. Thx Meetup!

Cannot disable group notifications I like MeetUp, a great service and the app is generally good. But there is a bug I noticed after joining a very active group where there are very frequent new discussions. In theory you can disable group notifications through the three dot menu on the group page (change push notifications-> get group notifications). But that doesn’t help. I am tried of getting a notification every time someone has an idea. I want to check them manually when I have the time.

Falls short for first-timers This app is great once your Meetup groups are established. It uses app notifications and email to remind you of scheduled meetups, and was prompt letting me know when I was moved from the waitlist to attendee. It’s also great at suggesting similar events.

Great! Depends on where though This is my third new city living in that I've used Meetup to meet people. It's definitely a great way to meet people based on mutual interests and to hear about events that perhaps you otherwise wouldn't have as a new person in town. Not every city uses meetup a lot though so it's better in slightly larger cities. But at the very least you can find some interesting places and cool people. All about what you put into it.

Easy to use yet loaded with functionality Getting the app made all the difference, I am going to more events now because of it. This app is so easy to use and looks so nice, it makes it all super simple and fun. I spend just a few minutes a week to find, choose, schedule, and interact with groups and events, and always have lots of interesting things to do! Meetup has been instrumental for me in getting out and enjoying life more.

Meetup Had my first meet up today and it went great !! It was a diverse group full of laughter. There’s a group for everything fitness, crafts, professionals, entrepreneurs, yoga, women, book clubs, and more! There’s something for everyone! I’m a huge introvert and took the chance to try this app. I’m already looking to join other groups! I live in Atlanta alone and thanks to this app I’m making friends and memories. Download the app guys and put yourself out there. You won’t regret it!

Meetups Have used Meetups to join surf, hike, run, volleyball, and social events all over Orange County and San Diego. Great, easy-to-use site. Helps fill in the gaps when I have down time. Tons of events for all tastes. The fitness Meetups - running groups, yoga, hiking, surfing - are the best way to get motivated and moving.

It works well when it works I'm having problems with this app. Recently it has just been crashing every time I try to open it (running iOS 10.3.3 on an iPhone 5). Before the crashes I was getting push notifications (little red bubble with a number) but none of the notifications showed up in my feed when I opened the app. Even when I can see new events sometimes they don't show up until later (huge lag) or I miss messages entirely. I've had messages just disappear after I try to send them. But when I first downloaded it everything worked like a dream. Wish it still did.

Grateful for Meetup In the last year I have made it to two life changing groups due to Meetup, a book club and a board gaming group. I have made life long friends because of both of these groups. I just moved to a new city and am excited to use Meetup to make new friends and find a new group of people to call family.

Awesome This is a great app to use for finding people who are interested in the same thing as you. You get posts for the groups you link into for meetings, events, etc. I found a great group that meets twice a month. First, we have dinner and then we discuss our reason for meeting. It's a bit of a support group, but it's a lot more than that.

Connect with likeminded people I think this app is awesome to connect with like minded people who enjoy the same things you like. The only issue I have is that some people use it to promote their business and don’t share there is a fee to attend a class. You have to ask them specifically so you are not surprised. However, I don’t think that is the apps fault. I think it’s the individuals who create the group to disclose if they charge for their meet up.

Love meetup I love Meetup. It's a great way to do things you love to do with others who love to do the same. I've had lots of great and interesting experiences through meetup that I would not have had otherwise. I have recommended it to many people over the years. Just put in your interests and meetup send you groups you may be interested in.  Or if a topic you are looking for doesn't exist, you can make your own group and others can join you. I love it.

Can’t post a photo of yourself anymore A lot of groups require that you have a photo of yourself. I had a photo and wanted to change it. I’ve been able to change it before, but this version (June 2019) apparently screwed that up. Now when you try to change your photo, it deletes the old one and never posts the new one.

Meetup is Great for Organizing and Managing Groups Meetup is a great platform for managing and organizing a group of people with a similar interest but not necessarily connected in other ways. It brings together people from all walks of life.

App not user friendly I have just joined Meetup and thought I was paying for a membership, however I was paying to be a group leader. I asked for a refund as I read in policy that they have 30 day cancelation fee. They answered me kindly, in a business like matter, and said I could not receive my money back. I do not want to waste my time going back and forth so I will bite the bullet and pay. I just moved to a new country and cannot be leader of a group as I don’t know anything about the area. I want to say that my experience using the app was not good and that their understanding of my situation was bad customer service by the company.

Meet Up As a career strategist, I often use meetup to find events that my clients can attend. I want them to practice speaking to others, hone their message and get comfortable in spontaneous conversations. The combination of social and professional options, along with setting and changing the search filters for what I want (which changes based on clients) and diverse activities including volunteering is ideal for me! Thank you for making my job a little easier!
Another frustrated organizer As an organizer, I agree with the previous comments about the problems with the new redesign. The site worked fine before.

Lifesaver After being widowed at 42, I found myself a bit lost.  Lost my best friend of 22years, many of our friends were couples and it was awkward to always be the extra, best friends now live out of state, so I had to make new friends.  Got me out there and within time, now run my own Meetup group for those grieving losses and getting out for walks to be with like minded folks, no pressure to share your story of why in the group, something to look forward to, fresh air and get some good endorphins engaged to fight off the blahs.

Great for on the go organizers Having the meet up app makes organizing a Meet Up so much easier. I can stay in touch with members, shoot them messages, track activity, and make the week-to-week meetings feel seamless because I always have access.  Easy to navigate. Clear. Haven’t come across any problems or glitches.  Can also share easily with people when I need them versus having to send them something once I get home.

Great opportunities! I use this for sports and I have met people and found the groups I am looking for with the interests I am looking for. I wish I would have had something like long before I started using it. It’s scary at first going to a meetup the butterflies but go have fun after you know it you will be a pro on the app and not afraid of the people you get to meet. I started soccer after 20 years and now am in great shape again !!!! Thank you meetup team !!!!!!

Great place to meet likeminded people and enjoy activities together I’ve been on meetup for nine months. It’s provided me with endless opportunities to golf, play cards, go out dancing and dining... you name it. Awesome website!  Whatever your interests, there are others out there who share those interests and, like yourself, are looking for others to enjoy those interests with. The meetup website provides the avenue to reach out to those people and plan things together.

Do what you like with others Downloaded the app to look for like-minded people to ride motorcycles with. Found what I was looking for quickly and easily. Lots of notifications for different kinds of meetups makes it easy to find other interests and even easier to stay in contact with multiple members for planning and/or questions. Public forums and ability to contact other members really simplifies meetup groups. Love the app!

Meetup This app enables individuals to look for groups that meet that are seeking to engage others in interests they share.  Because meetups are organized in a local area a participant has an opportunity to meet people with similar interests as well as participate in the planning of activities.

The notifications need work. I downloaded the app to keep tabs on updates surrounding events I’ve RSVPd to. I have turned off push notifications for one group multiple times now, and they still come up. I’ll get a push notification for one post, and then a few minutes later, I’ll get a second one for the same exact thing. Then the icon will tell me I’ll have 7+ things to look at. When I open the app to clear the number, it takes a long time for it to actually load the notices and go back to zero. Considering deleting the app and going back to checking my email for updates because this is incredibly frustrating.

One and the same event appears 50x in a roll Annoying app, one and the same event appears 50x in a roll, you keep scrolling for 5 minutes and nothing else beside one event you are even not interested in appears over and over again. Also some event organizers post their events 50x, slightly changing the name of the event to achieve more attendants. Some organizers tarn their events under interesting names, when you get there, you find yourself in some religious center, among people who try to establish a new religion and discus their new bible :) you end up reading their “bible”.

Great way to find groups with your interests The Meetup group is a great tool to find groups in your area that have a common interest.  It is easy to use and while it does not provide all the same functionality as their website, it is very convenient to use when a PC is not handy.  Their messaging tool and notification alert you when their is an update.  Above all I appreciate their Customer Support staff and their open mindedness unlike Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr, Flickr, Pinterest, etc.

Definitely Skeptical I decided I needed to meet new people even not being new to town. I was nervous and didn't know what to expect. To my absolute surprise I met a great group of girls and have been friends with some of them for over 2 years now. I was able to meet smart, funny, career-oriented women that have similar goals and interests as myself; I was able to surround myself with people that add value to my life. This experience gave me much more than I expected.
Need more features! I would like to fully interact with my Facebook account because it’s much easier to create content outside of Meetup.

Amazing way to build community I am a group leader on Meetup, as well as a member of several groups. I have great friends, but most of them are married with young kids, so it is a blessing that I have found Meetup groups!! I am able to maintain a very active lifestyle and continue self-improvement through various new groups! And making great friends/acquaintances along the way! You cannot complain that you are lonely when there are meetup groups!!

Great to get out of your comfort zone This app is awesome. Gets your out of your comfort zone and taps you into new communities no matter where you are at.  You can always dive into something completely new and find people to join you along the way with this app.  Helps to break current cycles you may be in or to just find Groups that are more aligned with what you enjoy.  It’s one of the better apps for well being in the world no doubt

Great Resource for Expanding Networks Although this app is relatively new, there are still events being posted daily. The spectrum of events and groups continues to grow and grow. I was able to expand some of my professional networks with this app by reaching out to other women coders in the Los Angeles area. It is a wonderful tool not just for professionals but for those just wanting to explore a new city, meet new friends, exercise, eat, play board games and so so much more.

Great place to get acquainted! Looking for a special interest group? A new dance partner? Have you relocated and looking for new things to do and a friendship circle? This is your app! Easy to find what interests you. Join, attend and mingle. I travel a lot and use the app to find things to do where I go. Meet new people. Make new friends. I have relocated and this app was the perfect instrument to get me out in my new community, finding things I like to do with like minds. Perfect!

Meetup I like meeting people interested in the same things I’m interested in thru meetup!  How can I add more then one picture so people can see a picture of me doing the sports that we do in common to build report before we go? There was also singles groups that wanted everyone to have a head shot. I used to be able to have seven pictures on my profile. Can you please add that feature back? Also I’m wondering for sports can you add something about skill level?  Thanks SkiYogaChick

Always been impressed This app is excellent across multiple platforms. Intuitive and easy to use. I don't personally care for the way it updates the last Meetup group I viewed, and sometimes when I view notifications, it doesn't update whatever the "viewed" flag is until the second notification. None of that is annoying enough to mark it down at all. Still a great app.

Fun and Useful App I’ve really enjoyed using the Meetup app so far. I’ve already gone to some fun meetups and the app hasn’t caused me any trouble and is easy to use. The only thing I dislike about it has more to do with the groups and less to do with the app. I don’t like that some groups come off as accessible to all the. Only allow 4-6 people to attend each event. Anyhow, I’d recommend using this app to connect with people in your community.

Excellent interaction I recently adopted a sweet pit mix that was afraid of other dogs.  We think she was isolated.  I have been working with Tasha for the last few months to get her to look but not react.  It has taken a bit of time but she is doing so good, I am a proud momma!  I am so happy that I was lucky enough to find Tasha, can’t even imagine where we would be today without the her guidance and support.  I highly recommend any of her classes or hikes. She is fantastic!

Message Filter is too strong!!! I just downloaded this app today and I’ve been trying to send a message back to someone who reached out to me but I can’t send even send a single message because it keeps being flagged for not being creative enough! I understand the purpose of the filter, for sure, but the worst part is I can’t even tell what’s being flagged, so I have no idea what to fix.

You will find even what you are not looking for At the beginning I was weary of this app. One more online thing where, if you don’t have adventurous friends( like me) you are set to go blindly into an abyss.

Took my money for subscription will not let me start group So I was super excited about this app but after paid my subscription fee to start a group it will not let me complete the group with absolutely no explanation. When I tried emailing for help and eventually a refund. I got an email saying they were too busy to personally answer my emails and referred me to frequently asked questions section. Just stinks because I am new to the area and was kinda excited about starting a group! Still waiting for help/refund whatever comes first I guess. Seems like people who want to start groups have the most complaints in reviews. I see why now.

Great way to meet people I’ve been a member since 2015. Being single and dedicating with life to work and going to the gym ,I didn’t have time to socialize or engage in activities I enjoy. It has given me the opportunity to meet people with similar interests.

Great Network and BI Resource I have enjoyed the local meet up events in the Twin Cities. The original used email updates and was alright. Once the app came, it added a lot of useful tools. For one, you can organize better.

Connect w/ like minds, ideas, learning, events, humans Love this app! Wish every group, planner, open event, city, church, organization, school, or committee used it! When you want to do something (anything) and you don’t know where to find people to do it with.... look here!
antidote to the isolation inherent in modern life. This is a great app that allows you to meet with like-minded people and discuss topics that you’re all enjoying.

MeetUp app much improved I started using MeetUp about 6years ago. It was not intuitive or user friendly. I’m so glad to see the improvements made. I enjoy the different reach it has from FB & IG. MeetUp still has some catching up to do to these other social media platforms particularly in sharing events to other groups. Yes, there should always be admin approval, but it is cumbersome to have the group admin re-do an event (that has already been created) just to get it onto another group.

Moving to a new place? This is my second time moving cross country and meet up has been a perfect outlet for me to dig my feet in and try new and different activities. The people are always welcoming and friendly. This app has helped expedite the often painful process of getting out there as the newbie. Highly recommend for anyone thinking of trying a new activity, skill, practicing old talents or moving to a new place!

Awesome app and site Love Meet Up. Have found all kinds of activities to do and met wonderful new friends from this site. The app makes it super convenient to sign up and keep track of what I’m doing or may want to do. Getting notifications helps make sure I see quickly what is scheduled so I can sign up before the activity fills up. Have had no issues with the app. Much easier to use than the webpage.

Absolutely terrible changes. I used to use this app about 3-4 years ago but stopped for a bit. I have moved out of the area and figured I’d reconfigure my settings and give it another try since I stay at home with my toddler and am always looking for new things to do. You can’t even make changes to your interests without doing it on the desktop version. And since when did groups start having to charge a fee to join? Definitely going to be getting onto the desktop version and deactivating my account completely, because again, can’t do that within the app either.  Thanks for ruining what used to be a good thing.

Extremely Frustrated!!! The new features has destroyed this app! No longer user friendly, can’t get assistance when you need it. Group emails not being received by members. I canceled an event just to see it pop back up onto my calendar and have members show up to a cancelled event. Ugh!! Deleted members reappear!! Can’t upload photos. I’m so done! I’m here now looking for a new app. It’s not worth the money anymore. They administrators promise you they are working on your issue... they never get back to you. it’s been a year and still having the same issues. The one thing that never fails and is always on time... is the deduction of your payments.
Intrusive UX You are required to sign up for an account to enter the app. It’s 2019, people. Pay attention to the endless Facebook scandals

Support site can’t solve problem with profile picture Help! I’ve already tried the support website and no luck. I tried to change my profile picture on my iPhone 6 and it wouldn’t change it. I then tried deleting my photo to add another and now I have no photo. It will not upload a photo. I went through the support site with no luck. I tried a ticket and it literally took me back to the basic instructions which didn’t work in the first place. I tried it on my son’s Galaxy with no luck. I’m about to be kicked out of a group because I have no picture.

Great Experience So Far! I used MeetUp to connect with a local occupational group. The app had many different meetUp groups to choose from so I was able to pick one that meets right near my house which was very helpful because I don’t have a lot of extra time to give. The group I met was super friendly and very helpful in answering some of the questions I had. I’ll definitely be going again next month!

Meetup gives opportunities The Meetup app is really great because it customizes opportunities and possibilities for each individual person. When I moved to the area I was able to look up walking, but not just walking but walking for people over 50. I also like that I don’t have to join something forever, I can try it out and see if the group is for me. Thanks to meet up for organizing these opportunities!

Constant notifications I am constantly getting notifications of messages in meetup groups. Messages I’ve already read. Messages that haven’t changed or been replied to. Just “oh we thought maybe you didn’t see the prior four notifications of this same damned message in the same damned group since we're not sure you saw it, even though you’ve clicked on the message notification to read the message already, so here’s your fifth notification in 15 minutes!!!

Never an excuse to be alone I find that there are always so many meetup options on here.  I’ve really enjoyed it.  I have not made it to too many events-Just a few but it’s so nice to have the option to meetup with other likeminded people. There really is no excuse to stay home or to not make more friends.  It just takes some courage and determination to put yourself out there and meet new people.

Domestic violence I’m always impressed that even in 2019 people don’t want to participate in domestic violence training. Domestic violence occurs to the rich and the poor yet Women and men would rather keep it in a closet. I hope next time more people come. I was very impressed with the speaker she has gone through a lot, yet she wants to help others in the community. Domestic violence occurs more now than ever and I wish more people would attend these meetings.

Needs improvements Selective push notifications don’t work for some groups. And the worst thing for me is an annoying feedback popup after meetups, it came with a recent update. I guess this feature should be switchable in settings.

Great place to connect I have changed my life through this service. There was a time I found support during my Divorce. There was a time I found my way to a group of people that became my family. There is also a group that led me to like minded gamers. The app makes this mobile. I connected with the desktop version . I also prescribe it to my patients in my Substance Use Treatment facility, as I am a Counselor for the last 19 yrs.

Great way to try something new Place that connects people from all of around the country. You can look through the meets according to date, according to location, or according to interest. My only complaint is that sometimes groups are created for the sake of creating a group and they really never put any events. You get excited about it and then you click to realize there’s no events. That’s not the apps fault. That’s not the apps fault; the app is good.
Accurate time Time efficiency, is overlooked with this app when trying to make plans.

It’s all about the people! I found drawing group with Meetup and it has been wonderful to share some good conversations with other artistic minds and create a few fun sketches along the way. If you don’t have many groups that interest you in your area try taking the courageous step of making your own! The app is just a medium to initiate a get together, it’s up to you to show up and put your best foot forward.

Great for the organizers of MeetUps I really like the improvements on this app for organizers of MeetUps.    I can now make edits and photos and schedule events more easily on the go.   (I wish I could announce the meet ups from the app.  It would also be cool if we could have a schedule option to make announcements)

It is about time! I am love there is this app for people who are in their mid-singles. It gives us a chance to learn from really terrific people, but also gives us a chance to meet interact with friends who have common interests. Thank you so much for those who have made groups and provided spots for meet up sessions. I only hope that someday I can be clever and thoughtful enough to come up with my own meet up group!

Excellent way to meet new people while traveling I’ve been using Meetup off and on since 2007! I’ve found that depending on the country, some people are more active on meetup than others. I have used it in LA, Mexico City, London and Barcelona with good success. However, I found it wasn’t really used in Hamburg. Just depends on the city/country but is an excellent way to find new activities, meet like-minded people and learn new things!

Connections to great groups and activities I enjoy the Meetup app to explore and find groups of interest, see what events and activities I might want to join, and be reminded of those I am involved with. I can find events to do with others and make new connections.

Meetup App So let me start by saying I have been an organizer for 2 photography groups for the past 6 years. We are at over 4000 members between the two groups. I really liked the layout of the original site because I could show sponsors and images with my base text. I hope Meetup can find a way to add my sponsors links to the app.

Straightforward group connections for like-minded folks Great place to find folks who share the same interests! I’ve found three valuable meetups already, and the app is only just starting to be discovered by the general public. It’s like Facebook, but only for groups and events, streamlining the ability to connect diverse people. And of course, the more people get involved, the more diversity and specificity there will be.
Completely unusable **update: The problem seems to be resolved. I now have no issues with the app.

Worst Customer Service The idea of the app is great and the app itself is great...until you encounter a problem. They are definitely trying to scam you and take your money. If you have a problem or they overcharge you there is no way to contact them. They have no phone number they just tell you to send an email. When you send an email they take about 3+ weeks to respond. I am being overcharged every month and am not receiving what I am paying for and yet there’s nothing I can do because they will not answer my emails. I will be deleting this app and discontinuing their service and having all of my members do so as well.

Amazing If you are a business owner trying to expose yourself to new individuals. MEETUP is a great place to start. Not only do you have the ability to join Events and network. But you also have that great piece of mind knowing that you can be part of groups with like minded individuals who already share a topic your part of. It makes it a lot easier to talk to people when you have a common interest.

Needs a little work but good app overall This app has undergone several changes over the years. I can’t say that those changes have drastically improved much and I still find it fairly confusing to navigate, but I can usually find what I’m looking for. Getting to a calendar can be challenging though. I use this app almost daily and overall I’m happy with it. 2 stars for ease of use, 4.5 stars for information available to the user.
Easy to use, easy to connect Meetup makes it easy to find like-minded folks, build a community, and get-together.

Finding my tribe I am fairly new to the area and have not found many like-minded friends to explore ideas with. Meetup is a great tool to gain new experiences and perspectives through activities of interest. My favorite feature allows you to look at activities in the area at various times of the weekend. I did a wonderful group meditation in the morning and screened a powerful documentary in the afternoon all using meetup!

Meet Ups I wanted to personally thank this app for it has made me become very successful in my career! I started using this app during college and continued to meet up with like minded individuals in my local areas and helped me network and grow with my goals.

Meetup app is essential I am on the go enough that it is much too inconvenient to conduct meetup activity on my pc(s). In fact, I no longer do any meetup activity there anymore. The app is too convenient. I still spend hours each day on my pc, but for work related activity or streaming music and movies on my home stereo system. Ear pods are great but they really are no substitute for a large screen TV and a good home entertainment center.

Meetup I was just introduced to this app by a grief counselor as a way to meet friends following my husband’s death. I am new to the area and very lonely.  I was able to find a group immediately and two hours later was enjoying happy hour at Bonefish with a meal while visiting with my new group!  I would not have gone out alone!  It was just the medicine l needed to find a way to meet people and get on with my life.

Good grief!  And I am paying a monthly fee for this? I have been a MeetUp organizer for over 2 years.  I use a Safari browser on an up to date iPad. There have always been problems with the website but the last month is even worse than usual.  The website will no longer copy an event.  Photos will not upload. (And yes, I know how to do this.) The map will not let me change the address.  I tried the new app to see if it was any better and the app will NOT rotate to landscape so that I cannot use my iPad keyboard!  To top it all off, my credit card is being charged each month for this frustration.

Amazing app I adore the meet up app. I was looking for a social group that suffers from chronic pain. I was skeptical at first to go but after attending, I’m so happy I did! I’ve met amazing people who experience the same pain I go through on a daily basis. I’m learning so much from attend the support group. I’m forming lifelong friendships that are very rare in this day in age. There are so many social group on Meet Up. I plan on attending other groups as well.

It’s kinda okay The app has a nice interface. I wish there was a way to edit any and all of my profile in the app. I’ve also had a bug pop up where I write a post or message to someone and it just doesn’t show up after I write it all out and post it, so I had to write it all again. I also have an issue where when someone wrote back to me, and the post was long enough to warrant a ‘read more’ selection so you can expand their message, it wasn’t actually linked to anything, so I can’t see the rest of their message. It’s just regular text.

Meetup brings us together The meetup app makes being social doing what already interests me seem as natural as if it all happened by chance. There’s a wonderful amount of groups here so that everyone can find their place. It can take searching to find the right ones, but I think it has been and will continue to be well worth the effort. The app has allowed me to abandon my comfort zone and share my life with others who want to do the same.

Small things Some Organizers have such pride about them that they can’t stand to see 1k members and only 30 attendees (which is a success btw) so they charge membership fees.... Huge CON ; had to leave a few groups bc of that. I just find that very selfish and greedy and it kills my passion. I would be more receptive if they charged a small fee per event. At least I can still participate; ppl can’t just make every event to deny them membership how is that meetup-meet people-network friendly??? these creators are delusional

Exactly what I was looking for! Moving to a new country can be challenging. You leave friends and family behind and start a new adventure. You feel a little disoriented and don’t know where to go for new activities and to meet new people. Meetup is such a well thought concept. It makes your life easier and it’s also easy to navigate and convenient. Very grateful for this app!

Great app Sometimes when I think to myself I have nothing to do , I’ll check the app  activities happing around me and just pop in provided space is available.   This is very good for me because of my work schedule.  Someday I may work 3 hrs and others I might work 10 hrs so it always hard to plan.    Meet up makes it so easy to always have something to do with like minded people.

Finally! A breath of fresh air! Excellent app that gives one the chance to join groups and meet people. Finally! You can send chat messages too but mainly you pick a group you like, check out their events and rsvp letting the event organizer your going. You also see others that are going too. Navigation is effortless and I’m so happy that I found this app! Now time to explore the city!

We had no idea... My wife and I recently relocated to Spokane, WA, from Austin, TX, and we had no idea that there was so much going on here, and so much diversity of interests. Way-to-go, Spokane, and similar kudos to MeetUp for the info.

Excellent Way to Meet New People Meetup is a great way to meet new people with similar interests. Meetup was integral in my transition to Atlanta and meeting fellow Yankee fans with whom I've become permanent friends beyond catching games. Meetup has also been unexpectedly effective in furthering my career with UX meetups. Next, I'm thinking about starting a suburban dad basketball league through Meetup. If you have an interest in expanding your horizons and making new friends socially or professionally, Meetup is an option not to be ignored.

Great app, opens up opportunities I wouldn’t have known about Where else would I find out about something so specific as “Gay Men Over 40 Hiking Group”? Meetup makes it easy to find and join events in your area, or where you’re traveling. Check it out, download and get started meeting new friends and having new experiences! I’ve been to dozens of events with 7 different groups so far, more to come!

Push notifications options The latest update added push notifications whenever a group that I’m a part of posts a new Meetup. I don’t want push notifications for all the new meet ups. However, I do want push notifications whenever I receive a message through the app or reminders that a Meetup is about to start. That is actually helpful.

Laura This has been so helpful! Not just in finding people that have the same concept of fun, but finding things to do has become simple. If you’re a scheduler, you could schedule your days away. If you’re a last minuter, you can rsvp that day and pop up. Perfect for all levels of activity and commitment. Only issue is that site can make details a bit cumbersome and clumsy to change and charges for groups limit possibilities.

Dope app. My friend told me about this app cause I wanted to get into comedy and I just didn’t know where I could find some comedy friends... downloaded it and followed different group around town I didn't even think I would be interested in but hey... we all need new friends to expand our life experience and this app help you find new things to do with a group of people that want that new experience feeling as well.

The software has frustrating glitches & no personal help! For some reason, the software picks up on those people who merely “LOOK” at this group, and turns them into “members” when in fact this is not the case! The stats say there are 47 members in this group. Not so! In fact there is only “one” member!

Meetup Ap Review Great ap for keeping us informed of available meetups and groups. Great about sending reminders, based on your account feedback. Would like more distance and/or specific location options for groups before being forced to join a group and then find out the meeting place is quite a distance away. Also, some age related options might also be of use. You don’t want to be the only one there over 50, etc.

Love this app for making meaningful connections I’ve made meaningful connections with people no matter where I’ve stayed through this app. I met a friend in 2013 and we are still friends to this day having lived in several different states over the last 7 years. You do get what you put in, but I highly recommend it if you are willing to get out of your comfort zone.

Flaw in Version 8.1.12 If you are attempting to attend a Meetup of which you are a member and there is a preset time to hit the “attend” button, the usual practice of refreshing the screen at the appointed time will FAIL to create an “attend button”. You must exit the event and reload which loses important seconds if the order of the sign-in determines an important aspect of the meeting. The creation of the lower window for the “attend” button defeats the primary purpose of Meetup, which is to sign-in for a meeting. This version is less responsive, less effective, and less useful. A version that decreases the functionality of an application’s primary purpose is a failure.

Love it! This app is helping me keep my head up while going through one of the biggest shifts in my life- I’ve cut off all on my (fake) friends, and I left my abusive boyfriend. I am alone, but meetup is helping me keep from becoming an isolate and staying alone. Socializing with the awesome, high-vibing, positive people through yoga meetups, toast masters, and brunches is really invigorating! I am excited to continue exploring the app and finding more magic. :)

Clear, Concise and Very Fun MeetUp is the perfect mix of getting  enough information about a huge variety of community events. You know just enough to be able to decide whether or not to go, but you can also ask questions and connected with others to know more. I’ve practiced Spanish, jammed with local musicians, spoken at open mics, created art, gone to dating events and so much more.

Terrific Way to Meet People and Enjoy New Experiences I have been able to sync up with gaming groups, film appreciation groups, and a local running team. So many of my very interested I have been enjoying any sort of “bubble“ for too long, now I have the added benefit of being able to participate in them with groups of like-minded people. Wonderful app, and wonderful communities to discover.

Minor issues I like the app. The design is standard fare for current iOS, though I appreciate the light grey bars to seperate sections. It looks great on my iPhone X. The only problem for me is that push notifications don't seem to be working. The app won't have any badges or popups/history yet when I go in the app there will be new updates/comments/likes etc. I have everything turned in both the phone and app settings and both are updated.

Meetup I’ve met some great folks! There are groups for every interest and they’re always doing fun things. I wish I’d discovered Meetup sooner. I’ve been a widow for 13 years and have spent most of that time alone and wishing I could meet people with whom I would have common interests. My social calendar is definitely a busy one now! There’s always something fun to do and great people to enjoy those fun times with you!
I recommend Meetup app I’ve had positive experiences meeting people with similar interests.  Work keeps me pretty busy and Meetup has been a safe and fun way to be more social.

Great app for new activities with friends and making new friends. I recently returned from Asia and it’s nice to meet people who have similar interests and or want to try new things. I’ve gone to a great card game meetup as well as soccer events. It’s great because I can plan or choose planned around my work schedule. I hope to continue to meet more great people. I’ll continue playing soccer with new people for sure.

Use case: digital nomad between locations OK, I’m a freelance UXer based in Vancouver. I travel between Vancouver, Bay Area, NYC, Beijing, Tokyo... Were called digital nomads and there are many of us.

Great app to meet others in your area of interest Whether it’s crafts, eating out or hiking this app is a fantastic find. You pick your hobby or area of interest and the app will point you to like-minded people. If for some reason you can’t find your area of interest, you can start your own group. I had a lot of fun meeting up with about 15 people in my age group for breakfast at a local restaurant.

Great way to meet people I have used the Meetup app for about 6 years now. It is a great way to meet people and find out about things to do around my area and places to go. Only problem I have with it is that when I open a link in Meetup's emails they always take me to the Meetup website rather than to the Meetup app which would be more useful. Other than that it is all good.

Homeschool parent’s best friend The Meetup app has been extremely helpful in our homeschool group. We are brand new to homeschooling and didn’t know any other families in the area. I heard about the app from a Facebook group and really like the added privacy of planning our activities in Meetup. For a community of busy home educators, this app is a great way to stay updated and informed about all of the events.

Good to start groups of people with similar interests or goals. I live in an area far away from family and most of my friends, and this has been a great app to help connect me with real people and to start to develop real networks and friendships with others with common interests.  This truly is social media, unlike the anti-social media we call social media.  A great way to get out and meet new people without needing to have any previous connection.

Great Network of Professional’s This app makes networking simplistic! Not only are you capable of meeting professionals to build your business and increase your customer base but you’re doing so by personal networking! This app also gives you the opportunity to meet people that share the same interest as you so that you’re not so alone in this world doing things by yourself!

Fantastic App I love the community that Meetup creates, from all areas of the spectrum. You can find anything that interests you or that appeals to your curiosity, all surrounded by others who enjoy the same enthusiasm and connection that these groups bring. The app is very user friendly and allows plenty of options when searching for your particular “tribe.” I’ll continue using it for sure.

My favorite app I love meet up. You get to get out and meet people in your own area that have the same interests as you do. Or if you want to learn something new or get involved in something else, you can find people interested in those things as well. And it’s free! I always tell people about meet up when they’re looking for new friends or looking for something to do.

Great app, great meetups! The app is solid. It lets us all communicate in real-time before the meetups which saved my bacon one time when I was running late. Lots of nice features for finding and participating in meetups: picture sharing, blogging, likes, etc. Let’s people participate without sharing personal info if that’s what they want. Nothing bad to say here and I’ve been using it a long time (2+ years).
Soccer It just played my first game through this app and it was a really good experience, you can also meet people and exchange numbers to create your own games at other times.

So far loving it. I first used this app a few years ago while in college to look for a community of French language learners to help with my own learning. I am glad to say I did find a group that meet up at local cafe every Wednesday at 7PM and I when whenever I could I loved it. I am happy to have found an app to connect me when new people with the same goals quite easily.

Needs an update When some posts a new event, I do not get notified, even though my settings are correct. I miss a lot of new events, because I don't get notified. I get notified when someone messages me or comments on something I'm a part of .....but that's it. Also..the app seems sluggish when uploading pics. It would be nice if we could upload multiple pics instead of one at a time. Takes forever.

BookGroup is one of my monthly events I look forward to the most We have had such success cultivating a diverse group of women to discuss books and create a  warm and caring community with.  This is one event I have every month that I always thoroughly enjoy and look forward to.  So very thankful to meet up for creating this platform which lends itself to meaningful connection with wonderful people.

Simple functions missing. This is a great concept. There are many great things about MeetUp. This app is in my opinion a little lacking. One can easily get a stupid ridiculous number of notices per day if one doesn’t manage their notifications properly. One’s message box fils with these notifications of events. They also fail your email address’s junk folder.

User interface is Terrible Almost everything is a button. Just wanted to scroll down? Nope, you put your finger there, and it happened to be a button/link although it’s not obviously such, and you are now sent to a section that you may have been before already. This is like the app equivalent of a mid 90s web blog where every word is a link, except in this app, every title and even the white space is a hidden button leading somewhere 😡

Needing new? This is a great app after you’ve experienced a quarter or mid-life crisis where you realize the places you’ve been spending your time no longer feeds your personal nor soul needs. This is an app that will connect you to the right people at the right time in your life to help you grow.

Easy to use, million different activities This is a great app.  Easy to sign up.   Easy to navigate and find activities or hobbies that you’re interested in.  You can find groups who organize card games, to road trips, basketball games, etc.   Every event I have attended or participated in have been fun and inviting.  Great way to try to new things and meet new people have have similar interests!

Never a stranger wherever you go I just love what Meetup has done. It’s very much unlike meeting people and trade up sites. It’s meeting people face-to-face in real time over subjects of deep interest to you and them. Sometimes social, sometimes or engaging topics of deep interest. For me it has been French, Italian, Mythology. Wherever you happen to be in this world it’s a way of reaching out to others who share your interests in life.

So easy I am a member of several groups in Meetup. Have been for over a decade now. This app is so easy to use and I can check in effortlessly weeks in advance to schedule a Meetup, to check in minutes to verify the location where I am supposed to meeting my new friends or even check in after the Meetup to tell all my new friends it was great to meet them! The app does it all!

The app everyone needs on their phone I love this app so much! I have met so many people & found so many wonderful things to do that I never would have known about otherwise. From yoga classes, meditation/chakra groups, to pagan/shaman & witchy fun- there is literally so much going on around you. Meetup allows you to get out & explore everything! Everyone should have this app on their phone. 💕

The best social networking app period. This is the first time that I’m ratting an app, and it’s because it worth it to do it. For me this app represent more than an app, is more than an social network, more than a networking site, more than a date app, it’s is how all the social media apps should be, with more than one purpose. This app represent a life style , a way to have friends with common interests, to be more social IN THE REAL WORLD.

fire your software dev have you even tried half your features? go and try to change a profile pic to a photo in an album on your phone. seriously try it. now fire anyone who let that process make it through QA.
Easy AND fun to use! I love my Meetup app! It’s only improved over time and is a very functional app that gets me going socially and integrated into my new community whenever I move into a new city.

Great Opportunities but comments heavily censored Only one use for me and I appreciate the multitude of events available but I notice that that any feedback that is less than stellar is censored.  That is something to keep in mind whenever you choose an event - that comments can evidently be erased by the organizer.  Having run some very small community web pages I understand the need for censorship but only accepting saccharine posts can portray an experience not shared by many and the potential for being deceptive.

This is a great app & can help u network & meet like minded people. I enjoy music & play guitar & Uke.  Thanks Meetup for helping to meet so many musicians who have helped me develop my skills & it’s so much fun!  Meetup Is a great way to meet new people & develop new skills.  The app is easy to use & the people are wonderful.  Special thanks to the group leaders who give their time & often money to benefit others & contribute to their community.

Love Meetup I was new to town and started joining some groups, and it was the best thing I could have done! I am meeting a lot of people and having a great time! Everybody has a story and it is interesting to learn it. Also it is so much more fun doing things with others than doing it all by yourself. Highly recommend joining! You meet people with similar interest and in similar life situation!

An anomaly This is a decent app that has creative SO UGLY, incongruous and bizarre that I shudder slightly every time I use it. I keep using it bc it’s quite utilitarian, but never, and I do mean NEVER have I encountered a decent app so hampered by extraordinarily terrible creative choices. Make it white and black. Do everything in helvetica, but for god sake, stop with the bizarre pics of old people in body paint and wigs doing strange things. Stop with the infantile font and paint splatters. Restore default settings. Save yourself! Sack your creative director. Immediately. Godspeed.

Wish uploading multiple photos for the profile were possible I’m not crazy about the current format of app, maybe its the aesthetics but doesn’t seem easy for finding what Im looking for.   A calendar icon and then options of past current and future events for profile as well as group would be helpful. Im just not into the  layout .  Also would be great to be able to upload multiple profile pics like on Yelp to show more interests and personality

Horrible The app doesn’t work half the time.  The service via the App or computer is awful. As an organizer meeting notices and messages would sit in limbo and not be delivered.  You can’t even quit Meetup via the app and good luck trying to do it via computer.  If I could give this negative stars I would. Use Facebook. It’s free and reliable. Meetup is not! If you try to cancel your subscription as an organizer they charge your card even if you put your group as do not renew. Then you have to fight to get your money and they troll your members trying to sucker one of them to step up and pay their fees to take over.

Why do I have to pay to be an organizer? The developers need to speak with an economist about the incentives that they’ve set up. I would love to be an organizer, but I’m not about to pay to do extra work. I’d love to organize meeting and start a new group, but I’m not going to pay to do that. Since I’m not going to pay to create a group in Laramie, Wyoming and nobody else is, there aren’t any groups here. You’re preventing people from using your app because of the way incentives are set up. I’d much rather pay $2 for the app and be able to be an organizer or not than pay ridiculous sums of money just to start a group.

Helped organize my book club “Meet-up” was really a great help in organizing, advertising and promoting our science fiction book club. We’ve been able have book voting, links to places to purchase our reading materials and pictures promoting our films.

Outstanding venue Meetup has changed my life, it has giving me a life, I’ve got tons of new friends and my calendar is now always full, thanks to the originator, awesome concept. If you can find nothing to do or anyone to do it with, this is the place to come, if you can think of it, there’s probably someone else looking to do it to and here you can get together and enjoy it. Peace!

Stick with your browser Whenever I want to add members as moderators I have to go to the website on the browser, but it keeps trying to open the app every time I do that. So I end up having to delete the app to add a member as moderator and then redownload the app. To be honest, I don’t know why I even bother redownloading the app, there is nothing I can do on it that I can’t do in the browser, and the app only interferes with stuff I need to do in the browser. I guess I’m realizing right now that I need to stop downloading this app, it’s less than useless, it’s a hinderance.

What is happening around me? The meet up app is an excellent way to get introduced to things that may be of interest to me. I simply fill in my areas of interest and almost magically events With those parameters that are happening in my area appear on my computer. Then I get to choose what I want to attend. A very basic and simple way to become more aware of what is available.

This business has a purpose beyond profit and a mission that matters Tonight I had the honor of meeting with CEO of Meetup, David Siegel, and have to say I have been converted to being a raving fan of Meetup. They were born out of the rubble of the 911 tragedy. They are committed to a purpose beyond profit and a mission that matters. David is as authentic an executive as I’ve ever met. Truly inspiring, and I few very committed to supporting Meetup as much as they support our SV-ELC community. Thank you Meetup Team!

The app makes meeting people & doing things so easy! I have been using the Meetup app for years & find it super easy. It is seamless between my different systems—iPhone app & web-based for my iPad and PC. As a ‘mature’ adult with even older people in some of my Meetups, I like that I can recommend it to others who may not be very tech savvy with confidence that they can easily find their way.

Useless For my purposes as an organizer, the Meetup App is useless. I can’t find any way to edit Meetups or take attendance. Only the next Meetup shows. Can’t find any way to see past Meetups... It’s just frustrating and useless.

It’s great but no landscape mode I like meetup and it is indispensable because so many people use it. It still does not have landscape mode, though. I usually delete any app without landscape mode because I have to pick up my iPad, take off the Smart Keyboard, find the prop holder, put it in place, and then use the app. Ironically, when rating it in the App Store, it reverted back to landscape mode, so I had to do all of the above in reverse to type this review.

Meetup great for making friends The concept of the app is wonderful, local events with people who share your interests. The app is easy to navigate, visually appealing, and loads quickly. There are so many events to choose from on a daily and weekly basis!! If I don’t find the event, I have the option to host my own meetup. I’m so excited to use this app after moving to a new area!

I’m enjoying meeting people with the same interests. I really enjoy belonging to Meetup groups. I like these groups because it’s a great place to get together with other people who have the same interests. I’ve also improved my photography skills by learning new things. If you’re looking for new friends, join a Meetup group and have fun doing what you love to do with other people. You don’t have to be alone anymore. Join a Meetup group!!

Amazing opportunity to connect Meetup is such a wonderful app for people new to Boise. In the brief time I’ve utilized the App, I have met quite a few people who have made Boise now feel more like home to me instead of just a residence.

Makes life exciting! This app is great. Last summer I felt really lonely and isolated and had trouble finding stuff to do, but this app is great for connecting with people, finding things to do, and just getting out there! I feel like I’m living life more fully thanks to this app and it’s opened up new opportunities and experiences for me. Great example of how technology can be GOOD and can bring people together.

Meetup helps build community I’m a transplant whose been a workaholic and have few local “friends”, so this app has helped me find others with similar interests as me. Plus, found topics that I had no clue about and was able to read about or attend the groups to check it out.

Easy! Does what you need it to. I like that you can adjust your notification settings to get rid of e-mail notifications or push notifications, specifically. Scrolling is very easy and the app seems to have all the filtering you see when you log in online, which is really nice (my groups only, my groups and suggestions, etc.)!

Perfect I used to feel bad for people that complain about not having friends but then I moved to a new city and started trying to find new friends and found this app recommendation online soooo now I realize people that don’t have friends just aren’t trying hard enough. I tried a bunch of groups but they weren’t a perfect fit so I made my own.

Great app In the 21st century, there’s been a lot of dating apps to come out. There are some of us in this world who are seeking just friends or to meet new people in our respective areas of interest. The meetup app is a great way to find events and groups near you. I’ll be going to my first meetup event soon, and I hope to continue to use the app to network and make friends in the technology industry.

Excellent This is an excellent group. I’ve been to places I would have never of had been able to go to. Everyone I’ve met are very social, friendly and always make you feel welcomed. I’ve been scalloping, dancing, walking, kayaking, cocktails, rooftop tapas just to name a few activities. I would recommend everyone to join. There’s a group for all interest!! Happy Meeting Up!

After School Clubs For Grown Up “Kids” Made some great friends through here and continue to have fun, new experiences. Sometimes we get stuck in a rut between work and college and feel like our social circles are limited. Well, they’re not :) There’s groups for rock climbing, cooking, movie buffs, charities, and sooo many more. Would highly recommend for people looking to network and make friends.

Fun and safe activities The group I joined locally for meeting up with other outdoor enthusiasts has been great. I have enjoyed the options the group offers and the safety in being outdoors doing different adventures in a group of diverse and friendly locals. The app is easy to use and has many features such as RSVP and private messaging. Thank you for helping my goals become reality for 2019

LOVE “Meet Up!” I just joined a few weeks ago and I’m finding mostly everything I need here! If you can think of it, then most likely, you can find it. The people in the groups are also great! Warm, friendly and inviting. It’s a wonderful way to engage socially (in any of the 5 NYC boroughs) while you’re learning about your preferred point of attraction. Mine happens to be speaking French and Italian.

Great Way To Meet Friends Started using a few months ago and a lot of diversity in groups to join. Some are free to join and others have a cost depending on what your looking for at the time. You can message, search groups, pay within the app, etc. It’s a great concept for when your new to and area or looking for a change or activity.
Rate Overall I like the app. The only thing I don’t care far is that when you have a notification that there is new groups in the meet up, you cannot block them so that they don’t keep popping up.

Meet up Orlando This organization offers a variety of social/business\networking/fun groups. Groups may serve more than one purpose. There are some for LGBT, men only and women only. There are some w/ age restrictions (i.e.: boomer, under 50, seniors and so on. Some are involved w/ physical activity, while others are focused on wine and food tasting and other entertainment.

Great! This is a great way for people to come together to relate. It is hard when you work many hours to get out and socialize. Joining groups gives you the drive and opportunities to meet people that share your interests, which builds into various levels of a relationships. This is a great app and I recommend joining if you struggle getting off the couch to join reality and socialize.

Meet up Glad I enjoyed this app I actually got to meet some people that were into the same stuff I was I had an amazing time after me and my girlfriend broke up after five months it was time for me to go on my own path to make new memories and find someone that will put up with me being myself I love this app I highly reccomend others to use it its amazing

Meetup is great at facilitating connections and community Meetup groups provide an easy way for people to meet others with a common purpose in a shared space. Whether it’s a philosophy discussion, working on a math problem, knitting, or hiking, almost every conceivable type of group can be easily formed using Meetup, and administrators can select from a variety of features to structure the group.

Meet new people and Do new Things What a wonderful way to take yourself out of a comfort zone. This is a way to connect yourself to local people and group that resonates with growing your circle. Definitely appreciate being around others that are open to new experiences and getting out of the social bubbles. Once you join you will not be turning back.

Way better than I expected!😁 I just moved to the outskirts of Atl and did not want to be restricted to my home. I googled things to do but I was looking for more. When I found the meetup app I started becoming more familiar with the area in the city and linked up with some awesome people! My experience has greatly been appreciated and definitely making this a regular thing to do!

Great App to meet people new people and build your business I have been using meet up to create events for my business and have gotten multiple attendees! As a host, you’re free to create as many events as you’d like for as many people as you want. It’s neat that you can see who joins your group, who RSVPs for your events, and all your messages in the same place.

Loving it for years I’ve been using Meetup for a little over two years now and really enjoy it. There’s so many diverse groups, and everyone seems so friendly and welcome. It’s especially good if you live in an area I don’t know many people. You will definitely make a lot of friends, and possibly meet a significant other if that’s your hope

No way to access account While the interface is otherwise useful, it’s horrible to use because you can’t make changes to your profile in the app and changes that you make in the desktop site don’t carry over. Want to add a picture? Nope. Do you want to even just log out? You can’t do that either. I added a profile pic on the website after I set up an account and the app still says that I don’t have one and there’s no way to reset it short of uninstalling and reinstalling the app.
Crib meet up I’ve been going to Crib Meet Up for a couple of months & everyone has been so helpful friendly & just fun to be around.
Meetup App This app allows me to stay connected to the 36 groups I participate in weekly events.

Great App - Sometimes Tricky to Navigate This app is awesome! Helping me to meet new people as I move to a new city. Definitely comforting to know there are others out there meeting up with similar interests. Sometimes when I go too deep into the links at the bottom of meetups, the “tags” I have a hard time making my way back to home. Otherwise, great UX/UI it’s a beautifully done app!

Great for Meeting a New Friend Great app, I discovered after moving to a new city where I didn’t know anyone and needed to find some friends and see what was what in the area. Each group is very different and great for various interests. It allows you to participate as much or as little as you like, which is great flexibility for me! I’ve met some great new friends through this app!

Great for networking I love this app for the simple fact I can look up any area for meetups as I travel a lot through out New Jersey. I like that I can find like minded people in social groups as well as professional use. I use this to leverage meet ups with potential clients I’m looking to work with and is a great way to meet them in a social setting and discuss business while networking with other people in the real estate industry.
MeetUp is my workout “partner”! I’m not the one who enjoys going to the gym, nor did I ever have to. But the only way I’m consistent is to essentially have a partner that can drag me to the gym.

Making new friends Love this APP✨moving to a new city like myself Meet-up makes it possible to stay connected with the activities & hobbies you enjoy. It’s great for traveling either personal or work related; there is always something going on I enjoy playing tennis wherever I travel to. Meet up hands down keeps you in the loop it’s also great for networking.

Great way to meet like-minded people This app is for everyone. There’s so many groups and ways to reach out. This allows neighborhoods to publish local events, social groups to meet about an interest, networking opportunities for business owners, and a fun way to meet new friends. It’s really easy to make a group of you don’t find one that suits you. I just wish this app has the ability to have access to Google Calendar.
Easy app and healthy way to get involved. This app is very easy to navigate. It’s a great way to meet like minded people in a healthy and safe environment.

Meetup provides new opportunities This app gives me an opportunity to find new things to do in the area, and meet new people that have my interests. It makes some suggestions, but allows me to do a lot of the search myself. I like that. Haven’t seen a lot of problems, but every app has some, so I hope everyone else is enjoying it the way I am!

There’s a group for everyone I saw one comment I agree with. There have been several times I showed up at a function and could never find the group, or only 1 or 2 people showed compared to the 20-30 that signed up. But for the most part the people I’ve met have very easy to talk to and I’ve had a good experience.

Love the app I didn’t do much activities posted to MeetUp app, but I have had it for a couple of years and I enjoyed browsing all of the events going on and well informed if I’m in the mood of going.  Best of all, it’s free to use the app.  Certain activities do cost a few bucks for membership, but they are for the benefit of the members.  I would recommend to anyone.

Great way to connect I’ve lived in my area for 4 years and have found it hard to find new friends since I’m not a church goer and I work a lot. This app has offered no risk and presented specific groups with which I share similar interests. I’ve signed up for several and have 2 activities I will be attending within a week of each other.

Keeps me social I don’t have a built-in tendency to remember to socialize, at least not in real life.  The meetup app helps me to discover new opportunities to do real-life socializing (as opposed to only online) and helps me keep in touch with new friends I’ve met at the meetups.  Slowly I see I am building up a tendency to get out and meet people more which is so important for me.  Thank you meetup!

Meetup review I’ve only been in Washington for a couple of months and this app is helping everything get put into place!! I joined yesterday and went to a Zumba class today and tomorrow there’s an essential oil discussion/workshop. It keeps my life full and interesting and I can’t wait to see what else I find. I hope to get some advice on environmental jobs in the area.

Great Idea! MeetUp is fantastic!  I recently moved and this provides me a way to meet people with the same interests as myself and allows the opportunity to explore new interests. I find it to be safe since we need a photo, there’s a record of attendees, you’re with a group and locations are clearly visible.  I’ve experienced some great events, trails and new people with this app, so I’m very appreciative to MeetUp.

Meetup - simple but effective way to enjoy common interest I joined a literature group and Meetup has made it so easy to get together and discuss great works.  The invitation/RSVP system works flawlessly with my on-line calendar and notifications keep me alert to conversations and shared ideas before and after we meet.  I really enjoy the support this app provides our group - thanks!

Great for professional or fun meetups It’s like finding a church but for anything, even for atheists (I am one). You can find professionals like investment groups or fun hangouts with people in your area to surf, ski, play games or even eat dinner together. I find that motivation for everything is just better when you are together with many people who have similar goals.

Great app to meet new people This is a great app to meet people with common hobbies and interests. I went yesterday to an Italian meetup at Roma Cafe in Rutherford NJ and had a wonderful time practicing my Italian language and meeting new and interesting people. I plan on doing more meet ups here. I highly recommend this app for people who want to socialize more and meet new people or simple enjoy a hobby or interest of their choice.

Excellent way to find activities I’ve been using Meetup for a few years and am very pleased with its ease of use. I’m an avid reader and knitter. With Meetup, I’m able to find people to knit with or a book club to participate in no matter where I am.
Very useful So far meetup has been very useful ad an advertising source. I like how our groups show up on Google search engine and has the events listed in an easy to follow arrangement.

Change to Paid Sign Ups I have been using this app for awhile and have always meant to come on to give 5 stars, but I just saw the announcement on the website for having to pay to join each meetup event. You have just killed the app, the entire drive is that it is free to sign up for things. We’ll probably have to start posting on Meetup with a link to a Facebook event to prevent our group from dying. Please cancel the change, it is a bad idea that is probably some MBA on a spreadsheet and not someone actually thinking about how this app fundamentally draws and holds users.

Better than any social media! Joined for a kayaking group I saw posted in TwoGoods and am loving it!  It’s kind of like social media but it’s all about meeting online, signing up for a group then actually going to the events. The whole idea is not to sit looking at your screen but getting out and physically doing something with people who have similar interests. It’s great!

Great way to find friends As a frequent mover 16 moves across 9 cities and 5 countries in 20 years, I always find it takes such a long time to get to know new people. The meetup app has helped me to connect with others - both like-minded and in a way that stretches me beyond my comfort zone. What a wonderful technological service to address our somewhat impersonal world.
Easy to navigate - and a community which sustains it! I appreciate the scheduling and ease of exploring activities, but most importantly there is an active community!

Pretty good app, but... This is a pretty good app, they try to sell you on more meetups by pushing other Meetup groups onto your feed. You can select a drop down to eliminate them, but you have to do that every time you use the app. I don’t want to litter my upcoming meetups with groups that I don’t care about. At least give me a setting that lets me say whether or not I want to see other groups and remember my setting so I don’t have to set it every time. Less selling and more serving. Thanks.

Great for finding whatever you’re into to Living in a new place or just trying to get out of your comfort zone? Both for me, I’ve been finding great fun things to do near by and meeting some cool people along the way. I like that you can also search by your area if you don’t want to just look up an activity or specific date!

User I have been utilizing Meet Up for a while now. I have been member of a Chamber and a member of the local Rotary club, this helps stay connected. I recently moved locations and found this a great way to find like minded people. I love the networking and community service aspect of this tool.

Great Way to Connect I’ve used Meetup for years.  It’s great to be able to get all the info you need in one place: cancellations, time changes, etc.  it takes the guessing out of how much food to bring, how to get there and who is coming.  The best part is that everyone can post their photos and you have an instant history of every event.

Meet Up I have had this on my phone for sometime now and have used it occasionally! I think it is a great way to be connected to other people that have the same interests which is to go out meet people and have a great time. I appreciate knowing about the different events that are going on all around me, and it’s free. Thank you Meet Up!
Useful tool for hobbies, networking and learning Easy enough app to use and a useful tool to meet and learn from other groups with same interests.

Great idea, rather than dating. I just started this upon the death of my partner, but so far I have been impressed with the offerings. It is so much more valuable to me to meet with people who have like interests. Instead of online dating, which is fraught with all sorts of problems for serious-minded individuals, one can participate in pressure-free gatherings that focus on an activity or a topic.

Good way to safely meet people This has been an excellent way to meet local people, share fun hobbies & keep my social life from totally withering. I’ve run meetup groups and participated in others groups around the country & the only real challenge I’ve found is getting up the motivation to go once I’ve signed up.

Meet up app This has been a very good way to meet new people. I still feel like I could find more groups that are in my interest areas but some groups have so much going on that I almost feel guilty if I don’t participate. Some groups even have “rules” about how many events you attend which I don’t appreciate. However,  I have managed to find some good friends among the many participants!

Great service, great app Meetup is fantastic, as you know. This app does everything you want it to do. I especially appreciate the messaging ability because it’s nice to be able to message with people you only just met up with without worrying about giving away your phone number or becoming friends on social media.

Great App! Thanks to MeeUp I find friends of the same interest almost everywhere I move! I tend to live in new places every so often and I dislike going friend hunting!  MeetUp makes it easy for me to find a group where I’ll fit right in. I recommend it to everyone! I met the love of my life in one of the MeetUp groups. You just never know what could happen! Good luck!

Meetup Greetup I have used the app to meet new people when I moved to Atlanta 6 years ago and when my son moved to a new city, I encouraged him to do the same. It has been great! Meetup has also been used to help me to learn about new places and different events — some of which I’ve visited or attended without a Meetup group. The app is intuitive and the information relevant to its user is readily accessible due to the clean format. I’m a fan!

Good app I just started using this app. It gives lots of suggestions of things that might interest you and is pretty easy to use. At first, it was a little difficult to find what I was looking for until I figured out how to use it. But overall, is pretty user friendly. It’s been great finding fun things to do and meet others!

Great fun to be had by all I love this app because it's great when you're on the go! If you've committed to an event and not sure of the directions there's a feature that gets you there. I can upload moment by moment pictures and communicate safely with other members of my group without giving out my personal information. It allows me to say "it was nice meeting you" after an event. I love, love, love this app!

Great App! I came across meet up not to long ago and I must say it’s the best app I have downloaded. I’m able to join groups and network with people from all over. I know when all events are happening and reminders are sent to me. This app is easy to use and has allowed me to expand my real estate business with potential partners. Great tool !

Huge variety I’ve never seen such a variety of clubs and groups in one app before. I’ve joined at least 15 and am still joining! Highly recommend. Watch the events though; some groups haven’t been active in months and some are so popular that you need to reserve spots weeks in advance! Something for everyone for sure!

Meetup I have made it to a few events with the 317 meetup group. Great group to connect with. Beautiful diversity. Very energetic and outgoing. I like that there is always something for everyone happening on every day of the week. The hosts Graham and Dana are great people to meet. They and other hosts do a great job at adding a variety of things so that you can get out and meet new people.

Very good notifications Pretty good app. The notifications are helpful especially for last minute updates to group events when you don’t have everyone’s cell number to text. I like browsing groups and events more easily on the desktop but the app is okay, maybe better for use on a tablet.

Great app I’ve been a member of meetup for awhile, but just recently downloaded the app. The app makes it much easier to keep track of groups and events. The app is pretty user friendly too. I just wish they would add away to call organizers during a meet up. It can be difficult to find the group in certain venues.

Great app! The app is fairly easy to use and you can keep track of all the meetups you are part of and Meetup gives you notifications on events you are attending and it lets you see the events you are attending. The only thing is if it could let you look at the calendar of events you have each month, that way you can go back and see what meetups you can’t attend.

Quite enjoyable It was very enjoyable. I really liked it and can’t wait till the next meetup. However, I wish it was at a quieter place. It was sometimes hard hearing everybody else at my table. And I wish there was a table for ASL because I need practice with my ASL.
